4.title: The real future of space exploration
4.description: In this passionate talk, legendary spacecraft designer Burt Rutan lambasts the US government-funded space program for stagnating and asks entrepreneurs to pick up where NASA has left off.
4.author: Burt Rutan
4.keywords: TED, talks, NASA, aircraft, business, design, engineering, entrepreneur, flight, industrial design, invention, rocket science

5.title: Great cars are great art
5.description: American designer Chris Bangle explains his philosophy that car design is an art form in its own right, with an entertaining -- and ultimately moving -- account of the BMW Group's Deep Blue project, intended to create the SUV of the future.
5.author: Chris Bangle
5.keywords: TED, talks, business, cars, design, industrial design, invention, technology, transportation, art

6.title: Sampling the ocean's DNA
6.description: Genomics pioneer Craig Venter takes a break from his epic round-the-world expedition to talk about the millions of genes his team has discovered so far in its quest to map the ocean's biodiversity.
6.author: Craig Venter
6.keywords: TED, talks, DNA, biotech, entrepreneur, genetics, invention, oceans, science, technology, ecology, biology, biodiversity

8.title: A memorial at Ground Zero
8.description: In this emotionally charged conversation with journalist Kurt Andersen, designer David Rockwell discusses the process of building a viewing platform at Ground Zero shortly after 9/11.
8.author: David Rockwell
8.keywords: TED, talks, New York, architecture, cities, collaboration, culture, death, design, disaster relief, interview, memory, urban planning

9.title: To invent is to give
9.description: Inventor Dean Kamen lays out his argument for the Segway and offers a peek into his next big ideas (portable energy and water purification for developing countries).
9.author: Dean Kamen
9.keywords: TED, talks, business, cars, industrial design, innovation, invention, robots, science, social change, sustainability, technology, transportation

10.title: The killer American diet that's sweeping the planet
10.description: Forget the latest disease in the news: Cardiovascular disease kills more people than everything else combined -- and it’s mostly preventable. Dr. Dean Ornish explains how changing our eating habits can save lives.
10.author: Dean Ornish
10.keywords: TED, talks, culture, disease, food, global issues, health, health care, obesity, science

11.title: What separates us from chimpanzees?
11.description: Jane Goodall hasn't found the missing link, but she's come closer than nearly anyone else. The primatologist says the only real difference between humans and chimps is our sophisticated language. She urges us to start using it to change the world.
11.author: Jane Goodall
11.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, animals, culture, environment, global issues, nature, primates, science

12.title: Meet the future of cancer research
12.description: Eva Vertes -- only 19 when she gave this talk -- discusses her journey toward studying medicine and her drive to understand the roots of cancer and Alzheimer’s.
12.author: Eva Vertes
12.keywords: TED, talks, cancer, disease, health, science, technology, wunderkind

13.title: A master architect asks, Now what?
13.description: In a wildly entertaining discussion with Richard Saul Wurman, architect Frank Gehry gives TEDsters his take on the power of failure, his recent buildings, and the all-important "Then what?" factor.
13.author: Frank Gehry
13.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, business, creativity, culture, design, interview, invention

18.title: Biomimicry's surprising lessons from nature's engineers
18.description: In this inspiring talk about recent developments in biomimicry, Janine Benyus provides heartening examples of ways in which nature is already influencing the products and systems we build.
18.author: Janine Benyus
18.keywords: TED, talks, DNA, animals, biology, biomimicry, design, environment, evolution, fish, science, technology

19.title: How technology evolves
19.description: Tech enthusiast Kevin Kelly asks "What does technology want?" and discovers that its movement toward ubiquity and complexity is much like the evolution of life.
19.author: Kevin Kelly
19.keywords: TED, talks, choice, culture, evolution, future, history, philosophy, science, technology

26.title: If I controlled the Internet
26.description: How many poets could cram eBay, Friendster and Monster.com into 3-minute poem worthy of a standing ovation? Enjoy Rives' unique talent.
26.author: Rives
26.keywords: TED, talks, culture, entertainment, love, performance, philosophy, poetry

30.title: Surprising stats about child carseats
30.description: Steven Levitt shares data that shows car seats are no more effective than seatbelts in protecting kids from dying in cars. However, during the question and answer session, he makes one crucial caveat.
30.author: Steven Levitt
30.keywords: TED, talks, business, cars, culture, economics, parenting, statistics, transportation

31.title: How architecture can connect us
31.description: Architect Thom Mayne has never been one to take the easy option, and this whistle-stop tour of the buildings he's created makes you glad for it. These are big ideas cast in material form.
31.author: Thom Mayne
31.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, cities, culture, design, invention

32.title: Art with wire, sugar, chocolate and string
32.description: Vik Muniz makes art from pretty much anything, be it shredded paper, wire, clouds or diamonds. Here he describes the thinking behind his work and takes us on a tour of his incredible images.
32.author: Vik Muniz
32.keywords: TED, talks, Brazil, art, creativity, design, illusion, animation

33.title: Let's rethink America's military strategy
33.description: In this bracingly honest talk, international security strategist Thomas Barnett outlines a post-Cold War solution for the foundering U.S. military that is both sensible and breathtaking in its simplicity: Break it in two.
33.author: Thomas Barnett
33.keywords: TED, talks, culture, global issues, military, peace, technology, terrorism, war

34.title: Photos of endangered cultures
34.description: Photographer Phil Borges shows rarely seen images of people from the mountains of Dharamsala, India, and the jungles of the Ecuadorean Amazon. In documenting these endangered cultures, he intends to help preserve them.
34.author: Phil Borges
34.keywords: TED, talks, activism, culture, design, film, global issues, photography, social change, storytelling, art, indigenous peoples

35.title: How we discovered DNA
35.description: Nobel laureate James Watson opens TED2005 with the frank and funny story of how he and his research partner, Francis Crick, discovered the structure of DNA.
35.author: James Watson
35.keywords: TED, talks, DNA, culture, genetics, history, invention, science, storytelling, technology

36.title: The hidden world of shadow cities
36.description: Robert Neuwirth, author of "Shadow Cities," finds the world's squatter sites -- where a billion people now make their homes -- to be thriving centers of ingenuity and innovation. He takes us on a tour.
36.author: Robert Neuwirth
36.keywords: TED, talks, business, cities, culture, entrepreneur, future, global issues, social change, poverty, policy, global development

38.title: The accelerating power of technology
38.description: Inventor, entrepreneur and visionary Ray Kurzweil explains in abundant, grounded detail why, by the 2020s, we will have reverse-engineered the human brain and nanobots will be operating your consciousness.
38.author: Ray Kurzweil
38.keywords: TED, talks, biotech, business, culture, future, invention, robots, science, technology

39.title: A roadmap to end aging
39.description: Cambridge researcher Aubrey de Grey argues that aging is merely a disease -- and a curable one at that. Humans age in seven basic ways, he says, all of which can be averted.
39.author: Aubrey de Grey
39.keywords: TED, talks, aging, biotech, disease, engineering, future, health care, science, technology

40.title: The story of life in photographs
40.description: In this stunning slideshow, celebrated nature photographer Frans Lanting presents The LIFE Project, a poetic collection of photographs that tell the story of our planet, from its eruptive beginnings to its present diversity. Soundtrack by Philip Glass.
40.author: Frans Lanting
40.keywords: TED, talks, animals, art, design, evolution, fish, nature, photography, storytelling, global commons

42.title: Is this our final century?
42.description: Speaking as both an astronomer and "a concerned member of the human race," Sir Martin Rees examines our planet and its future from a cosmic perspective. He urges action to prevent dark consequences from our scientific and technological development.
42.author: Martin Rees
42.keywords: TED, talks, astronomy, climate change, complexity, cosmos, science, social change, technology, time, universe

43.title: Design is in the details
43.description: Showing a series of inspiring, unusual and playful products, British branding and design guru Paul Bennett explains that design doesn't have to be about grand gestures, but can solve small, universal and overlooked problems.
43.author: Paul Bennett
43.keywords: TED, talks, business, design, industrial design, product design

44.title: A philosophical quest for our biggest problems
44.description: Oxford philosopher and transhumanist Nick Bostrom examines the future of humankind and asks whether we might alter the fundamental nature of humanity to solve our most intrinsic problems.
44.author: Nick Bostrom
44.keywords: TED, talks, biotech, culture, future, global issues, happiness, philosophy, technology

48.title: Everyday inventions
48.description: Inventor and MacArthur fellow Saul Griffith shares some innovative ideas from his lab -- from "smart rope" to a house-sized kite for towing large loads.
48.author: Saul Griffith
48.keywords: TED, talks, MacArthur grant, collaboration, design, innovation, invention, materials, open-source, product design, technology

50.title: Happiness by design
50.description: Graphic designer Stefan Sagmeister takes the audience on a whimsical journey through moments of his life that made him happy -- and notes how many of these moments have to do with good design.
50.author: Stefan Sagmeister
50.keywords: TED, talks, art, design, happiness, typography, graphic design

51.title: Winning the oil endgame
51.description: In this energizing talk, Amory Lovins lays out his simple plan for weaning the US off oil and revitalizing the economy.
51.author: Amory Lovins
51.keywords: TED, talks, MacArthur grant, business, economics, energy, environment, green, science, technology

56.title: My wish: Manufactured landscapes and green education
56.description: Accepting his 2005 TED Prize, photographer Edward Burtynsky makes a wish: that his images -- stunning landscapes that document humanity's impact on the world -- help persuade millions to join a global conversation on sustainability.
56.author: Edward Burtynsky
56.keywords: TED, talks, TED Prize, art, cities, culture, design, environment, photography, pollution, social change

57.title: My wish: Three unusual medical inventions
57.description: Accepting his 2005 TED Prize, inventor Robert Fischell makes three wishes: redesigning a portable device that treats migraines, finding new cures for clinical depression and reforming the medical malpractice system.
57.author: Robert Fischell
57.keywords: TED, talks, TED Prize, business, disease, health care, invention, medicine, science, technology

59.title: My wish: Three actions for Africa
59.description: Musician and activist Bono accepts the 2005 TED Prize with a riveting talk, arguing that aid to Africa isn't just another celebrity cause; it's a global emergency.
59.author: Bono
59.keywords: TED, talks, AIDS, Africa, activism, entertainment, global issues, philanthropy, poverty, social change

60.title: Four American characters
60.description: Writer and actor Anna Deavere Smith gives life to author Studs Terkel, convict Paulette Jenkins, a Korean shopkeeper and a bull rider, excerpts from her solo show "On the Road: A Search for American Character."
60.author: Anna Deavere Smith
60.keywords: TED, talks, MacArthur grant, United States, culture, entertainment, history, interview, performance, performance art, race, sports, storytelling, theater

61.title: How the "ghost map" helped end a killer disease
61.description: Author Steven Johnson takes us on a 10-minute tour of The Ghost Map, his book about a cholera outbreak in 1854 London and the impact it had on science, cities and modern society.
61.author: Steven Johnson
61.keywords: TED, talks, cities, culture, design, health, history, map, science, urban planning, disease

62.title: Global priorities bigger than climate change
62.description: Given $50 billion to spend, which would you solve first, AIDS or global warming? Danish political scientist Bjorn Lomborg comes up with surprising answers.
62.author: Bjorn Lomborg
62.keywords: TED, talks, AIDS, Africa, business, choice, climate change, culture, disaster relief, economics, environment, future

67.title: How juries are fooled by statistics
67.description: Oxford mathematician Peter Donnelly reveals the common mistakes humans make in interpreting statistics -- and the devastating impact these errors can have on the outcome of criminal trials.
67.author: Peter Donnelly
67.keywords: TED, talks, culture, genetics, science, statistics, technology

68.title: Progress is not a zero-sum game
68.description: Author Robert Wright explains "non-zero-sumness" -- the network of linked fortunes and cooperation that has guided our evolution to this point -- and how we can use it to help save humanity today.
68.author: Robert Wright
68.keywords: TED, talks, culture, global issues, war, collaboration, evolutionary psychology

69.title: Dreams from endangered cultures
69.description: With stunning photos and stories, National Geographic Explorer Wade Davis celebrates the extraordinary diversity of the world's indigenous cultures, which are disappearing from the planet at an alarming rate.
69.author: Wade Davis
69.keywords: TED, talks, anthropology, culture, environment, film, global issues, language, photography, indigenous peoples

72.title: Technology's long tail
72.description: Chris Anderson, then the editor of Wired, explores the four key stages of any viable technology: setting the right price, gaining market share, displacing an established technology and, finally, becoming ubiquitous.
72.author: Chris Anderson
72.keywords: TED, talks, business, culture, economics, entertainment, marketing, technology

74.title: The route to a sustainable future
74.description: Worldchanging.com founder Alex Steffen argues that reducing humanity’s ecological footprint is incredibly vital now, as the western consumer lifestyle spreads to developing countries.
74.author: Alex Steffen
74.keywords: TED, talks, alternative energy, business, cities, collaboration, culture, design, environment, global issues, invention, sustainability

75.title: Why we should invest in a free press
75.description: A free press -- papers, magazines, radio, TV, blogs -- is the backbone of any true democracy (and a vital watchdog on business). Sasa Vucinic, a journalist from Belgrade, talks about his new fund, which supports media by selling "free press bonds."
75.author: Sasa Vucinic
75.keywords: TED, talks, business, culture, global issues, investment, media, philanthropy

76.title: The gentle genius of bonobos
76.description: Savage-Rumbaugh's work with bonobo apes, which can understand spoken language and learn tasks by watching, forces the audience to rethink how much of what a species can do is determined by biology -- and how much by cultural exposure.
76.author: Susan Savage-Rumbaugh
76.keywords: TED, talks, animals, apes, biology, culture, evolution, genetics, intelligence, language

77.title: The shrimp with a kick!
77.description: Biologist Sheila Patek talks about her work measuring the feeding strike of the mantis shrimp, one of the fastest movements in the animal world, using video cameras recording at 20,000 frames per second.
77.author: Sheila Patek
77.keywords: TED, talks, biology, biomechanics, oceans, online video, science, technology

78.title: Visual illusions that show how we (mis)think
78.description: Al Seckel, an expert on illusions, explores the perceptual illusions that fool our brains. He shares loads of cool tricks to prove that not only are we easily fooled, we kind of like it.
78.author: Al Seckel
78.keywords: TED, talks, brain, cognitive science, culture, design, illusion, psychology

79.title: How mobile phones can fight poverty
79.description: Iqbal Quadir tells how his experiences as a kid in poor Bangladesh, and later as a banker in New York, led him to start a mobile phone operator connecting 80 million rural Bangladeshi -- and to become a champion of bottom-up development.
79.author: Iqbal Quadir
79.keywords: TED, talks, alternative energy, business, communication, culture, global issues, invention, investment, microfinance, poverty, technology, telecom, transportation, global development

80.title: The life code that will reshape the future
80.description: Scientific discoveries, futurist Juan Enriquez notes, demand a shift in code, and our ability to thrive depends on our mastery of that code. Here, he applies this notion to the field of genomics.
80.author: Juan Enriquez
80.keywords: TED, talks, DNA, biotech, business, culture, genetics, invention, science, technology

81.title: Singing "What I Want"
81.description: Nora York gives a stunning performance of her song "What I Want," with Jamie Lawrence (keyboards), Steve Tarshis (guitar) and Arthur Kell (bass).
81.author: Nora York
81.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, live music, music, poetry, singer, performance

82.title: Luke, a new prosthetic arm for soldiers
82.description: Inventor Dean Kamen previews the prosthetic arm he’s developing at the request of the US Department of Defense. His quiet commitment to using technology to solve problems -- while honoring the human spirit -- has never been more clear.
82.author: Dean Kamen
82.keywords: TED, talks, culture, demo, global issues, health care, invention, peace, prosthetics, science, technology, war

83.title: My wish: Build the Encyclopedia of Life
83.description: As E.O. Wilson accepts his 2007 TED Prize, he makes a plea on behalf of all creatures that we learn more about our biosphere -- and build a networked encyclopedia of all the world's knowledge about life.
83.author: E.O. Wilson
83.keywords: TED, talks, TED Prize, ants, biodiversity, biology, global issues, insects, nature, science, technology, ecology

84.title: My wish: Let my photographs bear witness
84.description: Accepting his 2007 TED Prize, war photographer James Nachtwey shows his life's work and asks TED to help him continue telling the story with innovative, exciting uses of news photography in the digital era.
84.author: James Nachtwey
84.keywords: TED, talks, activism, culture, global issues, media, photography, poverty, social change, storytelling, art, war

85.title: My wish: Rebuilding Rwanda
85.description: Accepting the 2007 TED Prize, Bill Clinton asks for help in bringing health care to Rwanda -- and the rest of the world.
85.author: Bill Clinton
85.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, TED Prize, business, culture, economics, global issues, health care, technology

89.title: Why did I ski to the North Pole?
89.description: Arctic explorer Ben Saunders recounts his harrowing solo ski trek to the North Pole, complete with engaging anecdotes, gorgeous photos and never-before-seen video.
89.author: Ben Saunders
89.keywords: TED, talks, climate change, culture, exploration, global issues, personal growth, potential, sports, technology, travel

90.title: Unleash your creativity in a Fab Lab
90.description: MIT professor Neil Gershenfeld talks about his Fab Lab -- a low-cost lab that lets people build things they need using digital and analog tools. It's a simple idea with powerful results.
90.author: Neil Gershenfeld
90.keywords: TED, talks, computers, culture, engineering, invention, materials, science, social change, technology, education, code

91.title: Invest in Africa's own solutions
91.description: Jacqueline Novogratz applauds the world's heightened interest in Africa and poverty, but argues persuasively for a new approach.
91.author: Jacqueline Novogratz
91.keywords: TED, talks, business, culture, entrepreneur, investment, microfinance, philanthropy, poverty, global development

101.title: Casting a spell on the cello
101.description: Caroline Lavelle plays the cello like a sorceress casting a spell, occasionally hiding behind her wild mane of blond hair as she sings of pastoral themes. She performs "Farther than the Sun," backed by Thomas Dolby on keyboards.
101.author: Caroline Lavelle
101.keywords: TED, talks, cello, entertainment, music, performance, vocals, live music

104.title: Cradle to cradle design
104.description: Green-minded architect and designer William McDonough asks what our buildings and products would look like if designers took into account "all children, all species, for all time."
104.author: William McDonough
104.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, business, china, cities, culture, design, environment, global issues, sustainability, technology

105.title: The electricity metaphor for the web's future
105.description: The dot-com boom and bust is often compared to the Gold Rush. But Amazon.com founder Jeff Bezos says it's more like the early days of the electric industry.
105.author: Jeff Bezos
105.keywords: TED, talks, business, entrepreneur, history, innovation, invention, technology, web, electricity

108.title: A mockingbird remix of TED2006
108.description: Rives recaps the most memorable moments of TED2006 in the free-spirited rhyming verse of a fantastical mockingbird lullaby.
108.author: Rives
108.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, memory, performance, poetry, spoken word, storytelling

110.title: "Kiteflyer's Hill"
110.description: Singer/songwriter Eddi Reader performs "Kiteflyer's Hill," a tender look back at a lost love. With Thomas Dolby on piano.
110.author: Eddi Reader
110.keywords: TED, talks, composing, entertainment, guitar, memory, music, performance, piano, live music

112.title: Why would God create a tsunami?
112.description: In the days following the tragic South Asian tsunami of 2004, the Rev. Tom Honey pondered the question, "How could a loving God have done this?" Here is his answer.
112.author: Tom Honey
112.keywords: TED, talks, God, culture, disaster relief, global issues, natural disaster, philosophy, religion

114.title: A comic sendup of TED2006
114.description: Satirist Tom Rielly delivers a wicked parody of the 2006 TED conference, taking down the $100 laptop, the plight of the polar bear, and people who mention, one too many times, that they work at Harvard. Watch for a special moment between Tom and Al Gore.
114.author: Tom Rielly
114.keywords: TED, talks, comedy, culture, performance, humor

116.title: Dangerous memes
116.description: Starting with the simple tale of an ant, philosopher Dan Dennett unleashes a devastating salvo of ideas, making a powerful case for the existence of memes -- concepts that are literally alive.
116.author: Dan Dennett
116.keywords: TED, talks, culture, faith, meme, philosophy, religion

117.title: Cape Breton fiddling in reel time
117.description: Violinist Natalie MacMaster and TED Musical Director Thomas Dolby play Dolby's original song "Blue Is a River" in this ethereal duet -- with a little dancing.
117.author: Natalie MacMaster
117.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, history, music, performance, violin, live music

118.title: The genesis of Google
118.description: Google co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin offer a peek inside the Google machine, sharing tidbits about international search patterns, the philanthropic Google Foundation, and the company's dedication to innovation and employee happiness.
118.author: Sergey Brin + Larry Page
118.keywords: TED, talks, Google, business, collaboration, culture, design, technology, web

119.title: "Black Men Ski"
119.description: What happens when a black man visits Aspen? Singer/songwriter Stew and his band are about to let you know.
119.author: Stew
119.keywords: TED, talks, culture, entertainment, live music, music, performance, poetry, race, sports

121.title: The ghastly tragedy of the suburbs
121.description: In James Howard Kunstler's view, public spaces should be inspired centers of civic life and the physical manifestation of the common good. Instead, he argues, what we have in America is a nation of places not worth caring about.
121.author: James Howard Kunstler
121.keywords: TED, talks, alternative energy, architecture, cars, cities, consumerism, culture, design, energy, transportation

122.title: Human-centered design
122.description: IDEO's David Kelley says that product design has become much less about the hardware and more about the user experience. He shows video of this new, broader approach, including footage from the Prada store in New York.
122.author: David Kelley
122.keywords: TED, talks, collaboration, creativity, culture, design, museums, philanthropy, water, science and art

126.title: Swim with the giant sunfish
126.description: Marine biologist Tierney Thys asks us to step into the water to visit the world of the Mola mola, or giant ocean sunfish. Basking, eating jellyfish and getting massages, this behemoth offers clues to life in the open sea.
126.author: Tierney Thys
126.keywords: TED, talks, animals, biodiversity, climate change, environment, fish, global issues, oceans, science, technology, marine biology

127.title: Want to help Africa? Do business here
127.description: We know the negative images of Africa -- famine and disease, conflict and corruption. But, says Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, there's another, less-told story happening in many African nations: one of reform, economic growth and business opportunity.
127.author: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala
127.keywords: TED, talks, business, corruption, global issues, investment, women, women in business

128.title: Salvation (and profit) in greentech
128.description: "I don't think we're going to make it," John Doerr says in an emotional talk about climate change and investment. To create a world fit for his daughter to live in, he says, we need to invest now in clean, green energy.
128.author: John Doerr
128.keywords: TED, talks, climate change, environment, global issues, green, investment, sustainability, technology

130.title: We can be Buddhas
130.description: In our hyperlinked world, we can know anything, anytime. And this mass enlightenment, says Buddhist scholar Bob Thurman, is our first step toward Buddha nature.
130.author: Robert Thurman
130.keywords: TED, talks, Buddhism, God, culture, global issues, happiness, peace, religion

131.title: Rethink the desktop with BumpTop
131.description: Anand Agarawala presents BumpTop, a user interface that takes the usual desktop metaphor to a glorious, 3-D extreme, transforming file navigation into a freewheeling playground of crumpled documents and clipping-covered "walls."
131.author: Anand Agarawala
131.keywords: TED, talks, demo, interface design, software, technology

139.title: Tour Microsoft's Virtual Earth
139.description: Microsoft's Stephen Lawler gives a whirlwind tour of Virtual Earth, moving up, down and through its hyper-real cityscapes with dazzlingly fluidity, a remarkable feat that requires staggering amounts of data to bring into focus.
139.author: Stephen Lawler
139.keywords: TED, talks, design, map, microsoft, technology, virtual reality

140.title: New insights on poverty
140.description: Researcher Hans Rosling uses his cool data tools to show how countries are pulling themselves out of poverty. He demos Dollar Street, comparing households of varying income levels worldwide. Then he does something really amazing.
140.author: Hans Rosling
140.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, Asia, Google, economics, global issues, health, inequality, statistics, visualizations, global development, poverty

141.title: Inside the world's deepest caves
141.description: Bill Stone, a maverick cave explorer who has plumbed Earth's deepest abysses, discusses his efforts to mine lunar ice for space fuel and to build an autonomous robot for studying Jupiter's moon Europa.
141.author: Bill Stone
141.keywords: TED, talks, Moon, NASA, Planets, adventure, energy, exploration, mining, space, technology

142.title: The potential of regenerative medicine
142.description: Alan Russell studies regenerative medicine -- a breakthrough way of thinking about disease and injury, using a process that can signal the body to rebuild itself.
142.author: Alan Russell
142.keywords: TED, talks, cancer, design, health, health care, medicine, technology, bioethics

143.title: Flip your thinking on AIDS in Africa
143.description: Emily Oster re-examines the stats on AIDS in Africa from an economic perspective and reaches a stunning conclusion: Everything we know about the spread of HIV on the continent is wrong.
143.author: Emily Oster
143.keywords: TED, talks, AIDS, Africa, economics, global issues, health, science, statistics, HIV

144.title: The Web's secret stories
144.description: Jonathan Harris wants to make sense of the emotional world of the Web. With deep compassion for the human condition, his projects troll the Internet to find out what we're all feeling and looking for.
144.author: Jonathan Harris
144.keywords: TED, talks, design, entertainment, global issues, software, technology

145.title: The emergent genius of ant colonies
145.description: Deborah Gordon studies ant colonies in the Arizona desert to understand their complex social system. She asks: How do these chitinous creatures get down to business -- and even multitask when they need to -- with no language, memory or visible leadership? Her answers could lead to a better understanding of all complex systems, from the brain to the Web. Thanks, ants.
145.author: Deborah Gordon
145.keywords: TED, talks, ants, biology, collaboration, design, insects, science

147.title: Visualizing the wonder of a living cell
147.description: Medical animator David Bolinsky presents 3 minutes of stunning animation that show the bustling life inside a cell.
147.author: David Bolinsky
147.keywords: TED, talks, design, entertainment, film, health, medicine, science, technology, visualizations, animation

148.title: The  4 a.m. mystery
148.description: Poet Rives does 8 minutes of lyrical origami, folding history into a series of coincidences surrounding that most surreal of hours, 4 o'clock in the morning.
148.author: Rives
148.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, poetry, spoken word

149.title: How to get (a new) hip
149.description: When Allison Hunt found out that she needed a new hip -- and that Canada’s national health care system would require her to spend nearly 2 years on a waiting list (and in pain) -- she took matters into her own hands.
149.author: Allison Hunt
149.keywords: TED, talks, culture, health care, marketing, medicine

151.title: Africa's cheetahs versus hippos
151.description: Ghanaian economist George Ayittey unleashes a torrent of controlled anger toward corrupt leaders in Africa -- and calls on the "Cheetah generation" to take back the continent.
151.author: George Ayittey
151.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, business, economics, entrepreneur, global issues, philanthropy, corruption, global development

152.title: Aid versus trade
152.description: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, the former finance minister of Nigeria, sums up four days of intense discussion on aid versus trade on the closing day of TEDGlobal 2007, and shares a personal story explaining her own commitment to this cause.
152.author: Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala
152.keywords: TED, talks, economics, entrepreneur, global issues, health care, investment, philanthropy, women, women in business, global development, Africa, business

153.title: How I built a windmill
153.description: When he was just 14 years old, Malawian inventor William Kamkwamba built his family an electricity-generating windmill from spare parts, working from rough plans he found in a library book.
153.author: William Kamkwamba
153.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, alternative energy, design, energy, global issues, interview, library, technology

154.title: Why invest in Africa
154.description: South African investment banker Euvin Naidoo explains why investing in Africa can make great business sense.
154.author: Euvin Naidoo
154.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, business, entrepreneur, global issues, investment

155.title: Telling stories from Africa
155.description: In this deeply personal talk, Nigerian writer Chris Abani says that "what we know about how to be who we are" comes from stories. He searches for the heart of Africa through its poems and narrative, including his own.
155.author: Chris Abani
155.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, culture, entertainment, global issues, literature, poetry, storytelling

156.title: How to educate leaders? Liberal arts
156.description: A liberal arts education is critical to forming true leaders, says university head Patrick Awuah -- because it builds decision-making skills, an ethical framework and a broad vision. Awuah himself left a career at Microsoft in the US to found a liberal arts school in Africa: Ashesi University, in his home nation of Ghana. A passionate talk about dreaming, doing and leading.
156.author: Patrick Awuah
156.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, culture, education, global issues, leadership, social change

157.title: Patient capitalism
157.description: Jacqueline Novogratz shares stories of how "patient capital" can bring sustainable jobs, goods, services -- and dignity -- to the world's poorest.
157.author: Jacqueline Novogratz
157.keywords: TED, talks, business, global issues, investment, medicine, philanthropy, poverty, women, women in business, global development, markets

158.title: "Thula Mama"
158.description: South African singer-songwriter Vusi Mahlasela dedicates his song, "Thula Mama," to all women -- and especially his grandmother.
158.author: Vusi Mahlasela
158.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, activism, entertainment, live music, music, singer, women

159.title: Aid for Africa? No thanks.
159.description: In this provocative talk, journalist Andrew Mwenda asks us to reframe the "African question" -- to look beyond the media's stories of poverty, civil war and helplessness and see the opportunities for creating wealth and happiness throughout the continent.
159.author: Andrew Mwenda
159.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, business, global issues, investment, philanthropy, technology, global development

161.title: The joy of lexicography
161.description: Is the beloved paper dictionary doomed to extinction? In this infectiously exuberant talk, leading lexicographer Erin McKean looks at the many ways today's print dictionary is poised for transformation.
161.author: Erin McKean
161.keywords: TED, talks, culture, education, entertainment, language, books

163.title: The surprising decline in violence
163.description: Steven Pinker charts the decline of violence from Biblical times to the present, and argues that, though it may seem illogical and even obscene, given Iraq and Darfur, we are living in the most peaceful time in our species' existence.
163.author: Steven Pinker
163.keywords: TED, talks, business, culture, global issues, media, sociology, violence, war

164.title: What our language habits reveal
164.description: In an exclusive preview of his book The Stuff of Thought, Steven Pinker looks at language and how it expresses what goes on in our minds -- and how the words we choose communicate much more than we realize.
164.author: Steven Pinker
164.keywords: TED, talks, culture, language, psychology, Social Science

165.title: Building "self-aware" robots
165.description: Hod Lipson demonstrates a few of his cool little robots, which have the ability to learn, understand themselves and even self-replicate.
165.author: Hod Lipson
165.keywords: TED, talks, AI, cognitive science, demo, design, evolution, robots, technology

167.title: 10 ways the world could end
167.description: How might the human race end? Stephen Petranek lays out 10 terrible options and the science behind them. Will we be wiped out by an asteroid? Eco-collapse? How about a particle collider gone wild?
167.author: Stephen Petranek
167.keywords: TED, talks, climate change, future, global issues, humanity, space, technology, solar system, science, asteroid

170.title: My journey into movies that matter
170.description: Film producer Jeff Skoll (An Inconvenient Truth) talks about his film company, Participant Productions, and the people who've inspired him to do good.
170.author: Jeff Skoll
170.keywords: TED, talks, business, entertainment, film, global issues, philanthropy, social change, movies

171.title: An Iraq war movie crowd-sourced from soldiers
171.description: Filmmaker Deborah Scranton talks about and shows clips from her documentary The War Tapes, which puts cameras in the hands of soldiers fighting in Iraq.
171.author: Deborah Scranton
171.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, film, global issues, storytelling, technology, war

172.title: Designing for simplicity
172.description: The MIT Media Lab's John Maeda lives at the intersection of technology and art, a place that can get very complicated. Here he talks about paring down to basics.
172.author: John Maeda
172.keywords: TED, talks, art, design, simplicity, technology

174.title: My green agenda for architecture
174.description: Architect Norman Foster discusses his own work to show how computers can help architects design buildings that are green, beautiful and "basically pollution-free." From the 2007 DLD Conference, Munich; www.dld-conference.com
174.author: Norman Foster
174.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, cities, green, Best of the Web

175.title: Kids can teach themselves
175.description: Speaking at LIFT 2007, Sugata Mitra talks about his Hole in the Wall project. Young kids in this project figured out how to use a PC on their own -- and then taught other kids. He asks, what else can children teach themselves?
175.author: Sugata Mitra
175.keywords: TED, talks, children, cities, culture, education, global issues, teaching, Best of the Web

176.title: A flight on solar wings
176.description: Paul MacCready -- aircraft designer, environmentalist, and lifelong lover of flight -- talks about his long career.
176.author: Paul MacCready
176.keywords: TED, talks, alternative energy, business, design, drones, energy, flight, invention, technology, solar energy

177.title: The case for optimism
177.description: We've known about global warming for 50 years and done little about it, says Google.org director Larry Brilliant. In spite of this and other depressing trends, he's optimistic and tells us why. From Skoll World Forum, Oxford, UK, www.skollfoundation.org
177.author: Larry Brilliant
177.keywords: TED, talks, climate change, culture, global issues, health, peace, Best of the Web

178.title: This is Saturn
178.description: Planetary scientist Carolyn Porco shows images from the Cassini voyage to Saturn, focusing on its largest moon, Titan, and on frozen Enceladus, which seems to shoot jets of ice.
178.author: Carolyn Porco
178.keywords: TED, talks, NASA, Planets, design, exploration, science, space, technology, universe, visualizations, solar system

181.title: Life at 30,000 feet
181.description: Richard Branson talks to TED's Chris Anderson about the ups and the downs of his career, from his multibillionaire success to his multiple near-death experiences -- and reveals some of his (very surprising) motivations.
181.author: Richard Branson
181.keywords: TED, talks, aircraft, business, entertainment, entrepreneur, global issues, interview, music, space, technology

182.title: The illustrated woman
182.description: Author and illustrator Maira Kalman talks about her life and work, from her covers for The New Yorker to her books for children and grown-ups. She is as wonderful, as wise and as deliciously off-kilter in person as she is on paper.
182.author: Maira Kalman
182.keywords: TED, talks, art, children, culture, design, entertainment, happiness

184.title: 3 clues to understanding your brain
184.description: Vilayanur Ramachandran tells us what brain damage can reveal about the connection between celebral tissue and the mind, using three startling delusions as examples.
184.author: VS Ramachandran
184.keywords: TED, talks, brain, consciousness, culture, illness, illusion, science, technology

185.title: A commodities exchange for Ethiopia
185.description: Economist Eleni Gabre-Madhin outlines her ambitious vision to found the first commodities market in Ethiopia. Her plan would create wealth, minimize risk for farmers and turn the world's largest recipient of food aid into a regional food basket.
185.author: Eleni Gabre-Madhin
185.keywords: TED, talks, business, economics, food, global issues, technology, women in business, markets

187.title: Laws that choke creativity
187.description: Lawrence Lessig, the Net’s most celebrated lawyer, cites John Philip Sousa, celestial copyrights and the "ASCAP cartel" in his argument for reviving our creative culture.
187.author: Lawrence Lessig
187.keywords: TED, talks, business, creativity, entertainment, law, technology

188.title: "Tembererana"
188.description: Singer/guitarist Raúl Midón performs "All the Answers" in a world premiere at TED2007, followed by the sprightly "Tembererana."
188.author: Raul Midon
188.keywords: TED, talks, culture, entertainment, guitar, music, singer, technology, live music, performance

189.title: How electroshock therapy changed me
189.description: Surgeon and author Sherwin Nuland discusses the development of electroshock therapy as a cure for severe, life-threatening depression -- including his own. It's a moving and heartfelt talk about relief, redemption and second chances.
189.author: Sherwin Nuland
189.keywords: TED, talks, brain, depression, health care, illness, medicine, mental health, science, suicide, technology

190.title: The anthropology of mobile phones
190.description: Nokia researcher Jan Chipchase's investigation into the ways we interact with technology has led him from the villages of Uganda to the insides of our pockets. He's made some unexpected discoveries along the way.
190.author: Jan Chipchase
190.keywords: TED, talks, cities, communication, culture, design, global issues, technology, telecom

192.title: A critical look at geoengineering against climate change
192.description: Environmental scientist David Keith proposes a cheap, effective, shocking means to address climate change: What if we injected a huge cloud of ash into the atmosphere to deflect sunlight and heat?
192.author: David Keith
192.keywords: TED, talks, business, china, climate change, engineering, global issues, science, technology

193.title: Using biology to rethink the energy challenge
193.description: Juan Enriquez challenges our definition of bioenergy. Oil, coal, gas and other hydrocarbons are not chemical but biological products, based on plant matter -- and thus, growable. Our whole approach to fuel, he argues, needs to change.
193.author: Juan Enriquez
193.keywords: TED, talks, biodiversity, biotech, business, energy, science, technology

194.title: Beauty, truth and ... physics?
194.description: Armed with a sense of humor and laypeople's terms, Nobel winner Murray Gell-Mann drops some knowledge on TEDsters about particle physics, asking questions like, Are elegant equations more likely to be right than inelegant ones?
194.author: Murray Gell-Mann
194.keywords: TED, talks, String theory, physics, science, storytelling, technology

195.title: The sticky wonder of gecko feet
195.description: Biologist Robert Full shares slo-mo video of some captivating critters. Take a closer look at the spiny legs that allow cockroaches to scuttle across mesh and the nanobristle-packed feet that let geckos to run straight up walls.
195.author: Robert Full
195.keywords: TED, talks, design, evolution, robots, science, technology

196.title: The music wars
196.description: New York Times tech columnist David Pogue performs a satirical mini-medley about iTunes and the downloading wars, borrowing a few notes from Sonny and Cher and the Village People.
196.author: David Pogue
196.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, humor, music, technology

197.title: Design and destiny
197.description: Designer Philippe Starck -- with no pretty slides to show -- spends 18 minutes reaching for the very roots of the question "Why design?" Listen carefully for one perfect mantra for all of us, genius or not.
197.author: Philippe Starck
197.keywords: TED, talks, design, humanity, humor, philosophy, storytelling

198.title: The fractals at the heart of African designs
198.description: 'I am a mathematician, and I would like to stand on your roof.' That is how Ron Eglash greeted many African families he met while researching the fractal patterns he'd noticed in villages across the continent.
198.author: Ron Eglash
198.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, architecture, culture, design, math, technology

201.title: The lost art of letter-writing
201.description: Lakshmi Pratury remembers the lost art of letter-writing and shares a series of notes her father wrote to her before he died. Her short but heartfelt talk may inspire you to set pen to paper, too.
201.author: Lakshmi Pratury
201.keywords: TED, talks, communication, community, parenting, relationships, writing

203.title: We're worried about local warming ... in your lap
203.description: Investor and prankster Yossi Vardi delivers a ballsy lecture on the dangers of blogging. Specifically, for men.
203.author: Yossi Vardi

204.title: Tales of passion
204.description: Author and activist Isabel Allende discusses women, creativity, the definition of feminism -- and, of course, passion -- in this talk.
204.author: Isabel Allende
204.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, global issues, love, parenting, storytelling, women, world cultures, South America

207.title: Treat design as art
207.description: Paola Antonelli, design curator at New York's Museum of Modern Art, wants to spread her appreciation of design -- in all shapes and forms -- around the world.
207.author: Paola Antonelli
207.keywords: TED, talks, art, culture, design, museums, graphic design

208.title: The life-long learner
208.description: Wofford College president Bernie Dunlap tells the story of Sandor Teszler, a Hungarian Holocaust survivor who taught him about passionate living and lifelong learning.
208.author: Bernie Dunlap
208.keywords: TED, talks, culture, education, entertainment, library, literature, race, storytelling

209.title: Rebuilding a neighborhood with beauty, dignity, hope
209.description: Bill Strickland tells a quiet and astonishing tale of redemption through arts, music, and unlikely partnerships.
209.author: Bill Strickland
209.keywords: TED, talks, MacArthur grant, activism, children, cities, culture, philanthropy, live music

210.title: An unusual glimpse at celebrity
210.description: By making photographs that seem to show our favorite celebs (Diana, Elton John) doing what we really, secretly, want to see them doing, Alison Jackson explores our desire to get personal with celebs. Contains graphic images.
210.author: Alison Jackson
210.keywords: TED, talks, art, culture, entertainment, photography

211.title: TED's nonprofit transition
211.description: Chris Anderson gave this talk in 2002, prior to taking over leadership of TED. Co-founder Richard Saul Wurman was leaving, and TED's future was in the balance. He seeks to persuade TEDsters that what was then a for-profit conference had a secure future as an idea-based nonprofit endeavor.
211.author: Chris Anderson
211.keywords: TED, talks, business, community, culture, global issues, philanthropy, philosophy, technology

212.title: The idea behind Zipcar (and what comes next)
212.description: Robin Chase founded Zipcar, the world’s biggest car-sharing business. That was one of her smaller ideas. Here she travels much farther, contemplating road-pricing schemes that will shake up our driving habits and a mesh network vast as the Interstate.
212.author: Robin Chase
212.keywords: TED, talks, business, cars, cities, technology, transportation

213.title: A song of the city
213.description: Jaime Lerner reinvented urban space in his native Curitiba, Brazil. Along the way, he changed the way city planners worldwide see what's possible in the metropolitan landscape.
213.author: Jaime Lerner
213.keywords: TED, talks, Brazil, cities, culture, design, green, humor, sustainability, transportation, infrastructure, South America

214.title: A plant's-eye view
214.description: What if human consciousness isn't the end-all and be-all of Darwinism? What if we are all just pawns in corn's clever strategy game to rule the Earth? Author Michael Pollan asks us to see the world from a plant's-eye view.
214.author: Michael Pollan
214.keywords: TED, talks, animals, bees, business, culture, evolution, food, garden, global issues, science, plants, ecology

215.title: An illustrated journey through Rome
215.description: David Macaulay relives the winding and sometimes surreal journey toward the completion of Rome Antics, his illustrated homage to the historic city.
215.author: David Macaulay
215.keywords: TED, talks, MacArthur grant, ancient world, art, cities, communication, culture, design, humor, books

216.title: The new power of collaboration
216.description: Howard Rheingold talks about the coming world of collaboration, participatory media and collective action -- and how Wikipedia is really an outgrowth of our natural human instinct to work as a group.
216.author: Howard Rheingold
216.keywords: TED, talks, business, collaboration, communication, community, culture, global issues, humanity, wikipedia

217.title: What security means to me
217.description: Playwright Eve Ensler explores our modern craving for security -- and why it makes us less secure. Listen for inspiring, heartbreaking stories of women making change.
217.author: Eve Ensler
217.keywords: TED, talks, activism, culture, global issues, spoken word, technology, violence, war, women

218.title: The untouchable music of the theremin
218.description: Virtuoso Pamelia Kurstin performs and discusses her theremin, the not-just-for-sci-fi electronic instrument that is played without being touched. Songs include "Autumn Leaves," "Lush Life" and David Mash’s "Listen, Words Are Gone."
218.author: Pamelia Kurstin
218.keywords: TED, talks, live music, music, performance, technology

219.title: Building uniqueness
219.description: Looking back over his long career, architect Moshe Safdie delves into four of his design projects and explains how he labored to make each one truly unique for its site and its users.
219.author: Moshe Safdie
219.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, cities, collaboration, creativity, design, museums, visualizations

222.title: The Jill and Julia Show
222.description: Two TED favorites, Jill Sobule and Julia Sweeney, team up for a delightful set that mixes witty songwriting with a little bit of social commentary.
222.author: Jill Sobule + Julia Sweeney
222.keywords: TED, talks, collaboration, entertainment, guitar, humor, singer, storytelling, comedy

223.title: Juggle and jest
223.description: Illustrious jugglers the Raspyni Brothers show off their uncanny balance, agility, coordination and willingness to sacrifice (others). Now, if you'll just stand completely still...
223.author: Raspyni Brothers
223.keywords: TED, talks, collaboration, entertainment, humor, physics

224.title: A preview of the WorldWide Telescope
224.description: Educator Roy Gould and researcher Curtis Wong show a sneak preview of Microsoft's WorldWide Telescope, which compiles images from telescopes and satellites to build a comprehensive, interactive view of our universe.
224.author: Roy Gould + Curtis Wong
224.keywords: TED, talks, astronomy, collaboration, demo, science, technology, universe, telescopes

227.title: On the verge of creating synthetic life
227.description: "Can we create new life out of our digital universe?" Craig Venter asks. His answer is "yes" -- and pretty soon. He walks through his latest research and promises that we'll soon be able to build and boot up a synthetic chromosome. NOTE: This talk was given in 2008, and this field of science has developed quickly since then. Read "Criticisms & updates" below for more details.
227.author: Craig Venter
227.keywords: TED, talks, alternative energy, creativity, energy, genetics, global issues, invention, science, technology

228.title: A powerful idea about ideas
228.description: With all the intensity and brilliance for which he is known, Alan Kay envisions better techniques for teaching kids by using computers to illustrate experience in ways -– mathematically and scientifically -- that only computers can.
228.author: Alan Kay
228.keywords: TED, talks, children, collaboration, computers, design, technology

230.title: 5 predictions, from 1984
230.description: With surprising accuracy, Nicholas Negroponte predicts what will happen with CD-ROMs, web interfaces, service kiosks, the touchscreen interface of the iPhone and his own One Laptop per Child project.
230.author: Nicholas Negroponte
230.keywords: TED, talks, demo, design, entertainment, future, interface design, media, technology, movies

231.title: My days as a young rebel
231.description: Before he was a legend, architect Frank Gehry takes a whistlestop tour of his early work, from his house in Venice Beach to the American Center in Paris, which was under construction (and much on his mind) when he gave this talk.
231.author: Frank Gehry
231.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, collaboration, design, global issues, technology

232.title: My wish: Find the next Einstein in Africa
232.description: Accepting his 2008 TED Prize, physicist Neil Turok speaks out for talented young Africans starved of opportunity: by unlocking and nurturing the continent's creative potential, we can create a change in Africa's future.
232.author: Neil Turok
232.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, TED Prize, education, math, physics, science, technology

233.title: My wish: Once Upon a School
233.description: Accepting his 2008 TED Prize, author Dave Eggers asks  the TED community to personally, creatively engage with local public schools. With spellbinding eagerness, he talks about how his 826 Valencia tutoring center inspired others around the world to open
233.author: Dave Eggers
233.keywords: TED, talks, TED Prize, activism, children, collaboration, culture, design, education, entertainment, global issues, writing, teaching

234.title: My wish: The Charter for Compassion
234.description: People want to be religious, says scholar Karen Armstrong; we should help make religion a force for harmony. She asks the TED community to help build a Charter for Compassion -- to restore the Golden Rule as the central global religious doctrine.
234.author: Karen Armstrong
234.keywords: TED, talks, TED Prize, collaboration, faith, global issues, religion

235.title: The search for the true face of Leonardo
235.description: Mona Lisa is one of the best-known faces on the planet. But would you recognize an image of Leonardo da Vinci? Illustrator Siegfried Woldhek uses some thoughtful image-analysis techniques to find what he believes is the true face of Leonardo.
235.author: Siegfried Woldhek
235.keywords: TED, talks, art, demo, design, entertainment, history, technology

236.title: A look inside the brain in real time
236.description: Neuroscientist and inventor Christopher deCharms demonstrates a new way to use fMRI to show brain activity -- thoughts, emotions, pain -- while it is happening. In other words, you can actually see how you feel.
236.author: Christopher deCharms
236.keywords: TED, talks, biology, brain, business, demo, medicine, science, technology, visualizations

237.title: The call to learn
237.description: Clifford Stoll captivates his audience with a wildly energetic sprinkling of anecdotes, observations, asides -- and even a science experiment. After all, by his own definition, he's a scientist: "Once I do something, I want to do something else."
237.author: Clifford Stoll
237.keywords: TED, talks, culture, education, science, technology, web

239.title: Sputnik mania
239.description: Filmmaker David Hoffman shares footage from his feature-length documentary Sputnik Mania, which shows how the Soviet Union's launch of Sputnik in 1957 led to both the space race and the arms race -- and jump-started science and math education around the world.
239.author: David Hoffman
239.keywords: TED, talks, education, history, math, science, space, technology, war

243.title: New thinking on the climate crisis
243.description: In this brand-new slideshow (premiering on TED.com), Al Gore presents evidence that the pace of climate change may be even worse than scientists recently predicted. He challenges us to act.
243.author: Al Gore
243.keywords: TED, talks, activism, climate change, global issues, science

246.title: Inventing instruments that unlock new music
246.description: Tod Machover of MIT's Media Lab is devoted to extending musical expression to everyone, from virtuosos to amateurs, and in the most diverse forms, from opera to video games. He and composer Dan Ellsey shed light on what's next.
246.author: Tod Machover + Dan Ellsey
246.keywords: TED, talks, creativity, demo, design, entertainment, health care, live music, music, technology, writing

247.title: The new open-source economics
247.description: Yochai Benkler explains how collaborative projects like Wikipedia and Linux represent the next stage of human organization.
247.author: Yochai Benkler
247.keywords: TED, talks, Google, business, collaboration, economics, law, social change, technology, wikipedia

249.title: World-class health care
249.description: Dr. Ernest Madu runs the Heart Institute of the Caribbean in Kingston, Jamaica, where he proves that -- with careful design, smart technical choices, and a true desire to serve -- it's possible to offer world-class healthcare in the developing world.
249.author: Ernest Madu
249.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, activism, global issues, health, health care, heart health, public health, science, global development

250.title: Where does creativity hide?
250.description: Novelist Amy Tan digs deep into the creative process, looking for hints of how hers evolved.
250.author: Amy Tan
250.keywords: TED, talks, culture, entertainment, storytelling, writing

251.title: Making sense of string theory
251.description: Physicist Brian Greene explains superstring theory, the idea that minscule strands of energy vibrating in 11 dimensions create every particle and force in the universe.
251.author: Brian Greene
251.keywords: TED, talks, String theory, physics, science, universe

252.title: Your genes are not your fate
252.description: Dean Ornish shares new research that shows how adopting healthy lifestyle habits can affect a person at a genetic level. For instance, he says, when you live healthier, eat better, exercise, and love more, your brain cells actually increase.
252.author: Dean Ornish
252.keywords: TED, talks, aging, genetics, health, health care, medicine, science

253.title: CERN's supercollider
253.description: "Rock-star physicist" Brian Cox talks about his work on the Large Hadron Collider at CERN. Discussing the biggest of big science in an engaging, accessible way, Cox brings us along on a tour of the massive project.
253.author: Brian Cox
253.keywords: TED, talks, String theory, big bang, education, physics, science, technology, quantum physics

254.title: Wake up! It's They Might Be Giants!
254.description: In a very, very early-morning set, They Might Be Giants rock TED2007, playing "Older," "Bee of the Bird of the Moth," "Asbury Park," "Fingertips," and "The Alphabet of Nations." Plus they take phone calls from the dead.
254.author: They Might Be Giants
254.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, humor, music, live music, performance

258.title: 6 ways mushrooms can save the world
258.description: Mycologist Paul Stamets lists 6 ways the mycelium fungus can help save the universe: cleaning polluted soil, making insecticides, treating smallpox and even flu viruses.
258.author: Paul Stamets
258.keywords: TED, talks, biology, design, food, global issues, pollution, science, technology, fungi

259.title: Can we domesticate germs?
259.description: Evolutionary biologist Paul Ewald drags us into the sewer to discuss germs. Why are some more harmful than others? How could we make the harmful ones benign? Searching for answers, he examines a disgusting, fascinating case: diarrhea.
259.author: Paul Ewald
259.keywords: TED, talks, bacteria, biology, disease, evolution, global issues, health, illness, medicine, microbiology, science

260.title: Juggling as art ... and science
260.description: Michael Moschen puts on a quietly mesmerizing show of juggling. Don't think juggling is an art? You might just change your mind after watching Moschen in motion.
260.author: Michael Moschen
260.keywords: TED, talks, MacArthur grant, dance, entertainment, math, music, physics, sports

263.title: What's wrong with what we eat
263.description: In this fiery and funny talk, New York Times food writer Mark Bittman weighs in on what's wrong with the way we eat now (too much meat, too few plants; too much fast food, too little home cooking), and why it's putting the entire planet at risk.
263.author: Mark Bittman
263.keywords: TED, talks, environment, food, green, obesity, sustainability, Best of the Web

264.title: The astonishing hidden world of the deep ocean
264.description: Ocean explorer Robert Ballard takes us on a mindbending trip to hidden worlds underwater, where he and other researchers are finding unexpected life, resources, even new mountains. He makes a case for serious exploration and mapping. Google Ocean, anyone?
264.author: Robert Ballard
264.keywords: TED, talks, adventure, animals, biodiversity, education, exploration, fish, oceans, science, submarine

266.title: Designing objects that tell stories
266.description: Designer Yves Béhar digs up his creative roots to discuss some of the iconic objects he's created (the Leaf lamp, the Jawbone headset). Then he turns to the witty, surprising, elegant objects he's working on now -- including the "$100 laptop."
266.author: Yves Béhar
266.keywords: TED, talks, business, computers, creativity, design, sex, society

267.title: Moving sculpture
267.description: Sculptor and engineer Arthur Ganson talks about his work -- kinetic art that explores deep philosophical ideas and is gee-whiz fun to look at.
267.author: Arthur Ganson
267.keywords: TED, talks, art, design, engineering, entertainment, humor, philosophy

268.title: A hospital tour in Nigeria
268.description: Dr. Seyi Oyesola takes a searing look at health care in underdeveloped countries. His photo tour of a Nigerian teaching hospital -- all low-tech hacks and donated supplies -- drives home the challenge of doing basic health care there.
268.author: Seyi Oyesola
268.keywords: TED, talks, activism, design, health, health care, invention, public health, technology

269.title: Memes and "temes"
269.description: Susan Blackmore studies memes: ideas that replicate themselves from brain to brain like a virus. She makes a bold new argument: Humanity has spawned a new kind of meme, the teme, which spreads itself via technology -- and invents ways to keep itself alive
269.author: Susan Blackmore
269.keywords: TED, talks, brain, culture, design, evolution, meme, technology

270.title: The "bottom billion"
270.description: Around the world right now, one billion people are trapped in poor or failing countries. How can we help them? Economist Paul Collier lays out a bold, compassionate plan for closing the gap between rich and poor.
270.author: Paul Collier
270.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, activism, business, economics, global issues, politics, poverty, global development, inequality

271.title: Archeology, animal photography, BBQ ...
271.description: Nathan Myhrvold talks about a few of his latest fascinations -- animal photography, archeology, BBQ and generally being an eccentric genius multimillionaire. Listen for wild stories from the (somewhat raunchy) edge of the animal world.
271.author: Nathan Myhrvold
271.keywords: TED, talks, animals, dinosaurs, entertainment, exploration, fish, humor, photography, archaeology

273.title: The worldwide web of belief and ritual
273.description: Anthropologist Wade Davis muses on the worldwide web of belief and ritual that makes us human. He shares breathtaking photos and stories of the Elder Brothers, a group of Sierra Nevada indians whose spiritual practice holds the world in balance.
273.author: Wade Davis
273.keywords: TED, talks, anthropology, beauty, culture, faith, global issues, photography, religion, indigenous peoples

274.title: Institutions vs. collaboration
274.description: In this prescient 2005 talk, Clay Shirky shows how closed groups and companies will give way to looser networks where small contributors have big roles and fluid cooperation replaces rigid planning.
274.author: Clay Shirky
274.keywords: TED, talks, business, cognitive science, collaboration, culture, social change, society, technology

278.title: The birth of the computer
278.description: Historian George Dyson tells stories from the birth of the modern computer -- from its 17th-century origins to the hilarious notebooks of some early computer engineers.
278.author: George Dyson
278.keywords: TED, talks, computers, engineering, history, library, military, science, software, technology

279.title: Turning powerful stats into art
279.description: Artist Chris Jordan shows us an arresting view of what Western culture looks like. His supersized images picture some almost unimaginable statistics -- like the astonishing number of paper cups we use every single day.
279.author: Chris Jordan
279.keywords: TED, talks, art, beauty, business, culture, photography, plastic, statistics

280.title: Robots inspired by cockroach ingenuity
280.description: Insects and animals have evolved some amazing skills -- but, as Robert Full notes, many animals are actually over-engineered. The trick is to copy only what's necessary. He shows how human engineers can learn from animals' tricks.
280.author: Robert Full
280.keywords: TED, talks, animals, design, evolution, robots, science, technology, transportation

282.title: What happens when you lose everything
282.description: Nine days before TED2008, filmmaker David Hoffman lost almost everything he owned in a fire that destroyed his home, office and 30 years of passionate collecting. He looks back at a life that's been wiped clean in an instant -- and looks forward.
282.author: David Hoffman
282.keywords: TED, talks, culture, film, library, personal growth, storytelling, movies

288.title: One Laptop per Child, two years on
288.description: Nicholas Negroponte talks about how One Laptop per Child is doing, two years in. Speaking at the EG conference while the first XO laptops roll off the production line, he recaps the controversies and recommits to the goals of this far-reaching project.
288.author: Nicholas Negroponte
288.keywords: TED, talks, activism, computers, design, technology, Best of the Web

292.title: Stephen Hawking's zero g flight
292.description: X Prize founder Peter Diamandis talks about how he helped Stephen Hawking fulfill his dream of going to space -- by flying together into the upper atmosphere and experiencing weightlessness at zero g.
292.author: Peter Diamandis
292.keywords: TED, talks, business, flight, science, space, technology, universe

294.title: On humanity
294.description: Chris Abani tells stories of people: People standing up to soldiers. People being compassionate. People being human and reclaiming their humanity. It's "ubuntu," he says: the only way for me to be human is for you to reflect my humanity back at me.
294.author: Chris Abani
294.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, culture, entertainment, humanity, humor, literature, poetry, writing

298.title: "Peace on Earth"
298.description: Guitarist and singer Raul Midon plays "Everybody" and "Peace on Earth" during his 2007 set at TED.
298.author: Raul Midon
298.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, guitar, music, peace, singer, storytelling, performance, live music

299.title: A hero of the Congo forest
299.description: Botanist Corneille Ewango talks about his work at the Okapi Faunal Reserve in the Congo Basin -- and his heroic work protecting it from poachers, miners and raging civil wars.
299.author: Corneille Ewango
299.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, activism, animals, biodiversity, trees, war, ecology

300.title: Animate characters by evolving them
300.description: Torsten Reil talks about how the study of biology can help make natural-looking animated people -- by building a human from the inside out, with bones, muscles and a nervous system. He spoke at TED in 2003; see his work now in GTA4.
300.author: Torsten Reil
300.keywords: TED, talks, animals, biomechanics, demo, design, entertainment, gaming, technology, virtual reality, animation

301.title: My year of living biblically
301.description: Author, philosopher, prankster and journalist A.J. Jacobs talks about the year he spent living biblically -- following the rules in the Bible as literally as possible.
301.author: A.J. Jacobs
301.keywords: TED, talks, culture, entertainment, humanity, humor, religion, writing, comedy, Best of the Web

306.title: Let's look for life in the outer solar system
306.description: Physicist Freeman Dyson suggests that we start looking for life on the moons of Jupiter and out past Neptune, in the Kuiper belt and the Oort cloud. He talks about what such life would be like -- and how we might find it.
306.author: Freeman Dyson
306.keywords: TED, talks, Planets, astronomy, biotech, exploration, extraterrestrial life, physics, science, technology, universe, astrobiology

308.title: On technology and faith
308.description: Speaking at TED in 1998, Rev. Billy Graham marvels at technology's power to improve lives and change the world -- but says the end of evil, suffering and death will come only after the world accepts Christ. A legendary talk from TED's archives.
308.author: Billy Graham
308.keywords: TED, talks, Christianity, God, death, faith, religion, technology

315.title: A dig for humanity's origins
315.description: Louise Leakey asks, "Who are we?" The question takes her to the Rift Valley in Eastern Africa, where she digs for the evolutionary origins of humankind -- and suggests a stunning new vision of our competing ancestors.
315.author: Louise Leakey
315.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, ancient world, anthropology, apes, evolution, human origins, humanity, paleontology, science

316.title: The web as art
316.description: At the EG conference in December 2007, artist Jonathan Harris discusses his latest projects, which involve collecting stories: his own, strangers', and stories collected from the Internet, including his amazing "We Feel Fine."
316.author: Jonathan Harris
316.keywords: TED, talks, art, culture, entertainment, global issues, happiness, software, storytelling, web

318.title: A tour of modern architecture
318.description: Reed Kroloff gives us a new lens for judging new architecture: is it modern, or is it romantic? Look for glorious images from two leading practices -- and a blistering critique of the 9/11 planning process.
318.author: Reed Kroloff
318.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, art, business, design, humor

319.title: The next 5,000 days of the web
319.description: At the 2007 EG conference, Kevin Kelly shares a fun stat: The World Wide Web, as we know it, is only 5,000 days old. Now, Kelly asks, how can we predict what's coming in the next 5,000 days?
319.author: Kevin Kelly
319.keywords: TED, talks, communication, complexity, future, technology, web, Best of the Web

320.title: A computer that works like the brain
320.description: Researcher Kwabena Boahen is looking for ways to mimic the brain's supercomputing powers in silicon -- because the messy, redundant processes inside our heads actually make for a small, light, superfast computer.
320.author: Kwabena Boahen
320.keywords: TED, talks, brain, complexity, computers, design, engineering, science, technology, visualizations

321.title: The math and magic of origami
321.description: Robert Lang is a pioneer of the newest kind of origami -- using math and engineering principles to fold mind-blowingly intricate designs that are beautiful and, sometimes, very useful.
321.author: Robert Lang
321.keywords: TED, talks, art, design, engineering, math, origami, space

323.title: A family tree for humanity
323.description: All humans share some common bits of DNA, passed down to us from our African ancestors. Geneticist Spencer Wells talks about how his Genographic Project will use this shared DNA to figure out how we are -- in all our diversity -- truly connected.
323.author: Spencer Wells
323.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, DNA, anthropology, culture, evolution, genetics, race, science, diversity, indigenous peoples

324.title: How photography connects us
324.description: The photo director for National Geographic, David Griffin knows the power of photography to connect us to our world. In a talk filled with glorious images, he talks about how we all use photos to tell our stories.
324.author: David Griffin
324.keywords: TED, talks, animals, culture, design, entertainment, global issues, photography, storytelling

326.title: Shedding light on dark matter
326.description: Physicist Patricia Burchat sheds light on two basic ingredients of our universe: dark matter and dark energy. Comprising 96% of the universe between them, they can't be directly measured, but their influence is immense.
326.author: Patricia Burchat
326.keywords: TED, talks, astronomy, big bang, dark matter, education, energy, physics, science, time, universe, telescopes

327.title: Close-up card magic with a twist
327.description: Like your uncle at a family party, the rumpled Swedish doctor Lennart Green says, "Pick a card, any card." But what he does with those cards is pure magic -- flabbergasting, lightning-fast, how-does-he-do-it? magic.
327.author: Lennart Green
327.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, humor, illusion, magic

328.title: Dog-friendly dog training
328.description: Speaking at the 2007 EG conference, trainer Ian Dunbar asks us to see the world through the eyes of our beloved dogs. By knowing our pets' perspective, we can build their love and trust. It's a message that resonates well beyond the animal world.
328.author: Ian Dunbar
328.keywords: TED, talks, animals, brain, children, psychology, Best of the Web

329.title: Great piano performances, recreated
329.description: Imagine hearing great, departed pianists play again today, just as they would in person. John Q. Walker demonstrates how recordings can be analyzed for precise keystrokes and pedal motions, then played back on computer-controlled grand pianos.
329.author: John Q. Walker
329.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, live music, music, performance, piano, technology, Best of the Web

330.title: How I became an activist
330.description: Ory Okolloh tells the story of her life and her family -- and how she came to do her heroic work reporting on the doings of Kenya's parliament.
330.author: Ory Okolloh
330.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, activism, global issues, identity, media, technology

331.title: DNA folding, in detail
331.description: In 2007, Paul Rothemund gave TED a short summary of his specialty, DNA folding. Now he lays out in clear, abundant detail the immense promise of this field -- to create tiny machines that assemble themselves.
331.author: Paul Rothemund
331.keywords: TED, talks, DNA, MacArthur grant, creativity, nanoscale, physics, science, technology

333.title: What we think we know
333.description: Starting with four basic questions (that you may be surprised to find you can't answer), Jonathan Drori looks at the gaps in our knowledge -- and specifically, what we don't about science that we might think we do.
333.author: Jonathan Drori
333.keywords: TED, talks, education, illusion, media, science, technology

335.title: Our next giant leap
335.description: Peter Diamandis says it's our moral imperative to keep exploring space -- and he talks about how, with the X Prize and other incentives, we're going to do just that.
335.author: Peter Diamandis
335.keywords: TED, talks, business, design, exploration, science, space, technology

339.title: The web is more than "better TV"
339.description: In this absorbing look at emerging media and tech history, Peter Hirshberg shares some crucial lessons from Silicon Valley and explains why the web is so much more than "better TV."
339.author: Peter Hirshberg
339.keywords: TED, talks, business, history, media, technology, telecom, television, Best of the Web

340.title: How humans and animals can live together
340.description: The legendary chimpanzee researcher Jane Goodall talks about TACARE and her other community projects, which help people in booming African towns live side-by-side with threatened animals.
340.author: Jane Goodall
340.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, animals, biodiversity, environment, global issues, pollution, primates, science

343.title: Life in the deep oceans
343.description: With vibrant video clips captured by submarines, David Gallo takes us to some of Earth's darkest, most violent, toxic and beautiful habitats, the valleys and volcanic ridges of the oceans' depths, where life is bizarre, resilient and shockingly abundant.
343.author: David Gallo
343.keywords: TED, talks, animals, geology, life, oceans, science, submarine, technology, marine biology

344.title: How to survive a nuclear attack
344.description: The face of nuclear terror has changed since the Cold War, but disaster-medicine expert Irwin Redlener reminds us the threat is still real. He looks at some of history's farcical countermeasures and offers practical advice on how to survive an attack.
344.author: Irwin Redlener
344.keywords: TED, talks, global issues, history, medicine, technology, war

346.title: A free digital library
346.description: Brewster Kahle is building a truly huge digital library -- every book ever published, every movie ever released, all the strata of web history ... It's all free to the public -- unless someone else gets to it first.
346.author: Brewster Kahle
346.keywords: TED, talks, design, entertainment, film, history, library, media, music, technology, web, books, Best of the Web

347.title: Once upon a time, my mother ...
347.description: Storyteller Carmen Agra Deedy spins a funny, wise and luminous tale of parents and kids, starring her Cuban mother. Settle in and enjoy the ride -- Mama's driving!
347.author: Carmen Agra Deedy
347.keywords: TED, talks, children, entertainment, memory, storytelling

348.title: What's wrong with school lunches
348.description: Speaking at the 2007 EG conference, "renegade lunch lady" Ann Cooper talks about the coming revolution in the way kids eat at school -- local, sustainable, seasonal and even educational food.
348.author: Ann Cooper
