348.keywords: TED, talks, children, economics, education, food, global issues, green, Best of the Web

350.title: Playtime with Pleo, your robotic dinosaur friend
350.description: Pleo the robot dinosaur acts like a living pet -- exploring, cuddling, playing, reacting and learning. Inventor Caleb Chung talks about Pleo and his wild toy career at EG07, on the week that Pleo shipped to stores for the first time.
350.author: Caleb Chung
350.keywords: TED, talks, children, design, dinosaurs, entertainment, happiness, invention, play, technology, toy, Best of the Web

351.title: Health and the human mind
351.description: Listen closely -- Marvin Minsky's arch, eclectic, charmingly offhand talk on health, overpopulation and the human mind is packed with subtlety: wit, wisdom and just an ounce of wily, is-he-joking? advice.
351.author: Marvin Minsky
351.keywords: TED, talks, brain, health, humanity, humor, science, technology, psychology, evolutionary psychology

354.title: Human nature and the blank slate
354.description: Steven Pinker's book The Blank Slate argues that all humans are born with some innate traits. Here, Pinker talks about his thesis, and why some people found it incredibly upsetting.
354.author: Steven Pinker
354.keywords: TED, talks, brain, children, culture, language, philosophy, psychology, science, books

355.title: Robots will invade our lives
355.description: In this prophetic talk from 2003, roboticist Rodney Brooks talks about how robots are going to work their way into our lives -- starting with toys and moving into household chores ... and beyond.
355.author: Rodney Brooks
355.keywords: TED, talks, AI, design, humanity, intelligence, robots, technology

356.title: Things I've learned in my life so far
356.description: Rockstar designer Stefan Sagmeister delivers a short, witty talk on life lessons, expressed through surprising modes of design (including ... inflatable monkeys?).
356.author: Stefan Sagmeister
356.keywords: TED, talks, art, design, education, happiness, humor, work

358.title: Politics and religion are technologies
358.description: Noah Feldman makes a searing case that both politics and religion -- whatever their differences -- are similar technologies, designed to efficiently connect and manage any group of people.
358.author: Noah Feldman
358.keywords: TED, talks, culture, democracy, global issues, politics, religion, social change, society, war

359.title: The Blur Building and other tech-empowered architecture
359.description: In this engrossing EG talk, architect Liz Diller shares her firm DS+R's more unusual work, including the Blur Building, whose walls are made of fog, and the revamped Alice Tully Hall, which is wrapped in glowing wooden skin.
359.author: Liz Diller
359.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, art, cities, design, theater, Best of the Web

360.title: Moving photos of extreme drug-resistant TB
360.description: An ancient disease is taking on a deadly new form. James Nachtwey share his powerful photographs of XDR-TB, a newly drug-resistant strain of tuberculosis that has developed due to misused and inadequate medical treatments -- and that might be touching off a global medical crisis.
360.author: James Nachtwey
360.keywords: TED, talks, TED Prize, communication, design, media, photography, technology, art

361.title: Are games better than life?
361.description: Game designer David Perry says tomorrow's videogames will be more than mere fun to the next generation of gamers. They'll be lush, complex, emotional experiences -- more involving and meaningful to some than real life. With an excerpt from Michael Highland's film "As Real as Your Life."
361.author: David Perry
361.keywords: TED, talks, business, design, entertainment, gaming, technology

362.title: The Web as a city
362.description: Outside.in's Steven Johnson says the Web is like a city: built by many people, completely controlled by no one, intricately interconnected and yet functioning as many independent parts. While disaster strikes in one place, elsewhere, life goes on.
362.author: Steven Johnson
362.keywords: TED, talks, cities, communication, community, design, global issues, web

363.title: Lessons from past presidents
363.description: Historian Doris Kearns Goodwin talks about what we can learn from American presidents, including Abraham Lincoln and Lyndon Johnson. Then she shares a moving memory of her own father, and of their shared love of baseball.
363.author: Doris Kearns Goodwin
363.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, history, politics, sports, storytelling, work-life balance

365.title: Why do societies collapse?
365.description: Why do societies fail? With lessons from the Norse of Iron Age Greenland, deforested Easter Island and present-day Montana, Jared Diamond talks about the signs that collapse is near, and how -- if we see it in time -- we can prevent it.
365.author: Jared Diamond
365.keywords: TED, talks, culture, environment, global issues, history, social change, society, technology

366.title: Flow, the secret to happiness
366.description: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi asks, "What makes a life worth living?" Noting that money cannot make us happy, he looks to those who find pleasure and lasting satisfaction in activities that bring about a state of "flow."
366.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi
366.keywords: TED, talks, culture, global issues, happiness, music, psychology, work

372.title: Design and the Elastic Mind
372.description: MOMA design curator Paola Antonelli previews the groundbreaking show Design and the Elastic Mind -- full of products and designs that reflect the way we think now.
372.author: Paola Antonelli
372.keywords: TED, talks, art, brain, design, museums, graphic design

374.title: Aliens, love -- where are they?
374.description: Humorist John Hodgman rambles through a new story about aliens, physics, time, space and the way all of these somehow contribute to a sweet, perfect memory of falling in love.
374.author: John Hodgman
374.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, extraterrestrial life, humor, love, physics, science, time, comedy, movies

375.title: On glamour
375.description: In a timely talk, cultural critic Virginia Postrel muses on the true meaning, and the powerful uses, of glamour -- which she defines as any calculated, carefully polished image designed to impress and persuade.
375.author: Virginia Postrel
375.keywords: TED, talks, beauty, business, culture, entertainment, illusion, marketing, performance

377.title: Healing through diet
377.description: Dean Ornish talks about simple, low-tech and low-cost ways to take advantage of the body's natural desire to heal itself.
377.author: Dean Ornish
377.keywords: TED, talks, health, health care, medicine, science

379.title: Nature vs. humans
379.description: In 1998, aircraft designer Paul MacCready looks at a planet on which humans have utterly dominated nature, and talks about what we all can do to preserve nature's balance. His contribution: solar planes, superefficient gliders and the electric car.
379.author: Paul MacCready
379.keywords: TED, talks, demo, design, drones, flight, green, technology, transportation, solar energy

381.title: The face of AIDS in Africa
381.description: In this moving talk, documentary photographer Kristen Ashburn shares unforgettable images of the human impact of AIDS in Africa.
381.author: Kristen Ashburn
381.keywords: TED, talks, AIDS, Africa, activism, disease, global issues, health, media, photography, science, HIV

383.title: A story of mixed emoticons
383.description: Rives tells a typographical fairy tale that's short and bittersweet ;)
383.author: Rives
383.keywords: TED, talks, design, entertainment, humor, love, media, poetry, storytelling

385.title: Toys and materials from the future
385.description: The Inventables guys, Zach Kaplan and Keith Schacht, demo some amazing new materials and how we might use them. Look for squishy magnets, odor-detecting ink, "dry" liquid and a very surprising 10-foot pole.
385.author: Zach Kaplan + Keith Schacht
385.keywords: TED, talks, business, creativity, design, industrial design, invention, materials, science, smell, technology, toy

386.title: The story of Ezra
386.description: Filmmaker Newton Aduaka shows clips from his powerful, lyrical feature film "Ezra," about a child soldier in Sierra Leone.
386.author: Newton Aduaka
386.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, creativity, culture, entertainment, film, global issues, war

388.title: A flight through the ocean
388.description: Graham Hawkes takes us aboard his graceful, winged submarines to the depths of planet Ocean (a.k.a. "Earth"). It's a deep blue world we landlubbers rarely see in 3D.
388.author: Graham Hawkes
388.keywords: TED, talks, business, design, exploration, invention, oceans, technology, global commons

391.title: Walk the earth ... my 17-year vow of silence
391.description: For almost three decades, John Francis has been a planetwalker, traveling the globe by foot and sail with a message of environmental respect and responsibility (for 17 of those years without speaking). A funny, thoughtful talk with occasional banjo.
391.author: John Francis
391.keywords: TED, talks, activism, environment, global issues

392.title: Tales of creativity and play
392.description: At the 2008 Serious Play conference, designer Tim Brown talks about the powerful relationship between creative thinking and play -- with many examples you can try at home (and one that maybe you shouldn't).
392.author: Tim Brown
392.keywords: TED, talks, art, creativity, design, education, play, toy, Best of the Web

393.title: The science of scent
393.description: What's the science behind a sublime perfume? With charm and precision, biophysicist Luca Turin explains the molecular makeup -- and the art -- of a scent.
393.author: Luca Turin
393.keywords: TED, talks, Senses, beauty, happiness, materials, science, smell, technology

394.title: Science and democracy
394.description: Physicist Lee Smolin talks about how the scientific community works: as he puts it, "we fight and argue as hard as we can," but everyone accepts that the next generation of scientists will decide who's right. And, he says, that's how democracy works, too.
394.author: Lee Smolin
394.keywords: TED, talks, String theory, community, global issues, physics, politics, science, social change

395.title: A complicated hero in the war on dictatorship
395.description: Would you negotiate with someone you knew to be evil, to save lives? Samantha Power tells a story of a complicated hero, Sergio Vieira de Mello. This UN diplomat walked a thin moral line, negotiating with the world's worst dictators to help their people survive crisis. It's a compelling story told with a fiery passion.
395.author: Samantha Power
395.keywords: TED, talks, communication, global issues, morality, politics, terrorism, war

399.title: The story behind the Mars Rovers
399.description: At Serious Play 2008, Charles Elachi shares stories from NASA's legendary Jet Propulsion Lab -- including tales and video from the Mars Rover project.
399.author: Charles Elachi
399.keywords: TED, talks, Planets, design, exploration, physics, robots, science, space, technology, solar system, Mars, Best of the Web

400.title: Tidying up art
400.description: Ursus Wehrli shares his vision for a cleaner, more organized, tidier form of art -- by deconstructing the paintings of modern masters into their component pieces, sorted by color and size.
400.author: Ursus Wehrli
400.keywords: TED, talks, art, design, entertainment, humor, performance, simplicity, comedy

402.title: The Long Now
402.description: Stewart Brand works on the Clock of the Long Now, a timepiece that counts down the next 10,000 years. It's a beautiful project that asks us to think about the far, far future. Here, he discusses a tricky side problem with the Clock: Where can we put it?
402.author: Stewart Brand
402.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, art, design, future, technology

403.title: A tour of Nollywood, Nigeria's booming film industry
403.description: Zambia-born filmmaker Franco Sacchi tours us through Nollywood, Nigeria's booming film industry (the world's 3rd largest). Guerrilla filmmaking and brilliance under pressure from crews that can shoot a full-length feature in a week.
403.author: Franco Sacchi
403.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, creativity, culture, entertainment, film, global issues, media, technology, movies

404.title: The design of the universe
404.description: At Serious Play 2008, astrophysicist George Smoot shows stunning new images from deep-space surveys, and prods us to ponder how the cosmos -- with its giant webs of dark matter and mysterious gaping voids -- got built this way.
404.author: George Smoot
404.keywords: TED, talks, astronomy, culture, dark matter, design, physics, science, space, technology, time, telescopes, Best of the Web

405.title: What I'm worried about, what I'm excited about
405.description: Technologist and futurist Bill Joy talks about several big worries for humanity -- and several big hopes in the fields of health, education and future tech.
405.author: Bill Joy
405.keywords: TED, talks, business, future, health, science, technology

406.title: A foie gras parable
406.description: At the Taste3 conference, chef Dan Barber tells the story of a small farm in Spain that has found a humane way to produce foie gras. Raising his geese in a natural environment, farmer Eduardo Sousa embodies the kind of food production Barber believes in.
406.author: Dan Barber
406.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, food, global issues, sustainability, Best of the Web

407.title: Do the green thing
407.description: Andy Hobsbawm shares a fresh ad campaign about going green -- and some of the fringe benefits.
407.author: Andy Hobsbawm
407.keywords: TED, talks, business, climate change, design, entertainment, global issues, humor, media, sex

408.title: The coming neurological epidemic
408.description: Biochemist Gregory Petsko makes a convincing argument that, in the next 50 years, we'll see an epidemic of neurological diseases, such as Alzheimer's, as the world population ages. His solution: more research into the brain and its functions.
408.author: Gregory Petsko
408.keywords: TED, talks, aging, brain, business, health, public health, science, social change, technology, Alzheimer's

409.title: The mysterious lives of giant trees
409.description: Science writer Richard Preston talks about some of the most enormous living beings on the planet, the giant trees of the US Pacific Northwest. Growing from a tiny seed, they support vast ecosystems -- and are still, largely, a mystery.
409.author: Richard Preston
409.keywords: TED, talks, complexity, exploration, nature, science, trees, writing, fungi

410.title: Life in Second Life
410.description: Why build a virtual world? Philip Rosedale talks about the virtual society he founded, Second Life, and its underpinnings in human creativity. It's a place so different that anything could happen.
410.author: Philip Rosedale
410.keywords: TED, talks, cities, communication, community, computers, entertainment, entrepreneur, life, technology, virtual reality, Best of the Web

412.title: Demo: The Orb
412.description: Inventor Nick Sears demos the first generation of the Orb, a rotating persistence-of-vision display that creates glowing 3D images. A short, cool tale of invention.
412.author: Nick Sears
412.keywords: TED, talks, demo, design, entertainment, invention, technology, animation

413.title: The joyful tradition of mountain music
413.description: Folk musician and storyteller David Holt plays the banjo and shares photographs and old wisdom from the Appalachian Mountains. He also demonstrates some unusual instruments like the mouth bow -- and a surprising electric drum kit he calls "thunderwear."
413.author: David Holt
413.keywords: TED, talks, culture, entertainment, invention, music, storytelling, live music, demo

414.title: The playful search for beauty
414.description: The ceramics designer Eva Zeisel looks back on a 75-year career. What keeps her work as fresh today (her latest line debuted in 2008) as in 1926? Her sense of play and beauty, and her drive for adventure. Listen for stories from a rich, colorful life.
414.author: Eva Zeisel
414.keywords: TED, talks, creativity, design, exploration, play, art

416.title: A plea for bees
416.description: Bees are dying in droves. Why? Leading apiarist Dennis vanEngelsdorp looks at the gentle, misunderstood creature's important place in nature and the mystery behind its alarming disappearance.
416.author: Dennis vanEngelsdorp
416.keywords: TED, talks, animals, bees, disease, food, insects, life, nature, Best of the Web

418.title: My library of human imagination
418.description: Jay Walker, curator of the Library of Human Imagination, conducts a surprising show-and-tell session highlighting a few of the intriguing artifacts that backdropped the 2008 TED stage.
418.author: Jay Walker
418.keywords: TED, talks, business, culture, design, entertainment, entrepreneur, innovation, invention, library, technology, books, 3D printing

419.title: The price of happiness
419.description: Can happiness be bought? To find out, author Benjamin Wallace sampled the world's most expensive products, including a bottle of 1947 Chateau Cheval Blanc, 8 ounces of Kobe beef and the fabled (notorious) Kopi Luwak coffee. His critique may surprise you.
419.author: Benjamin Wallace
419.keywords: TED, talks, business, culture, entertainment, food, happiness, writing, books, Best of the Web

420.title: Why we make bad decisions
420.description: Dan Gilbert presents research and data from his exploration of happiness -- sharing some surprising tests and experiments that you can also try on yourself. Watch through to the end for a sparkling Q&A with some familiar TED faces.
420.author: Dan Gilbert
420.keywords: TED, talks, brain, choice, culture, entertainment, goal-setting, happiness, psychology, self, society

421.title: There might just be life on Mars
421.description: So the Mars Rovers didn't scoop up any alien lifeforms. Scientist Penelope Boston thinks there's a good chance -- a 25 to 50 percent chance, in fact -- that life might exist on Mars, deep inside the planet's caves. She details how we should look and why.
421.author: Penelope Boston
421.keywords: TED, talks, Planets, exploration, extraterrestrial life, geology, life, science, technology, universe, Mars, solar system

422.title: The science of sync
422.description: Mathematician Steven Strogatz shows how flocks of creatures (like birds, fireflies and fish) manage to synchronize and act as a unit -- when no one's giving orders. The powerful tendency extends into the realm of objects, too.
422.author: Steven Strogatz
422.keywords: TED, talks, biology, biomechanics, math, science, society, technology

423.title: Taking OLPC to Colombia
423.description: TED follows Nicholas Negroponte to Colombia as he delivers laptops inside territory once controlled by guerrillas. His partner? Colombia's Defense Department, who see One Laptop per Child as an investment in the region. (And you too can get involved.)
423.author: Nicholas Negroponte
423.keywords: TED, talks, children, computers, design, global issues, philanthropy, technology

426.title: Play! Experiment! Discover!
426.description: Biochemist Kary Mullis talks about the basis of modern science: the experiment. Sharing tales from the 17th century and from his own backyard-rocketry days, Mullis celebrates the curiosity, inspiration and rigor of good science in all its forms.
426.author: Kary Mullis
426.keywords: TED, talks, DNA, biology, curiosity, history, microbiology, science, technology

427.title: My journey in design
427.description: Designer John Maeda talks about his path from a Seattle tofu factory to the Rhode Island School of Design, where he became president in 2008. Maeda, a tireless experimenter and a witty observer, explores the crucial moment when design met computers.
427.author: John Maeda
427.keywords: TED, talks, computers, curiosity, design, technology, programming, code, personal growth, Best of the Web

428.title: Digging up dinosaurs
428.description: Strange landscapes, scorching heat and (sometimes) mad crocodiles await scientists seeking clues to evolution's genius. Paleontologist Paul Sereno talks about his surprising encounters with prehistory -- and a new way to help students join the adventure.
428.author: Paul Sereno
428.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, animals, biology, dinosaurs, evolution, exploration, history, life, paleontology

429.title: My dream of a flying car
429.description: Paul Moller talks about the future of personal air travel -- the marriage of autos and flight that will give us true freedom to travel off-road. He shows two things he's working on: the Moller Skycar (a jet + car) and a passenger-friendly hovering disc.
429.author: Paul Moller
429.keywords: TED, talks, design, engineering, invention, technology, transportation

430.title: Organic algorithms in architecture
430.description: Greg Lynn talks about the mathematical roots of architecture -- and how calculus and digital tools allow modern designers to move beyond the traditional building forms. A glorious church in Queens (and a titanium tea set) illustrate his theory.
430.author: Greg Lynn

431.title: Ways of seeing
431.description: Rob Forbes, the founder of Design Within Reach, shows a gallery of snapshots that inform his way of seeing the world. Charming juxtapositions, found art, urban patterns -- this slideshow will open your eyes to the world around you.
431.author: Rob Forbes
431.keywords: TED, talks, beauty, business, design, exploration, photography

433.title: The art and craft of bread
433.description: Batch to batch, crust to crust ... In tribute to the beloved staple food, baking master Peter Reinhart reflects on the cordial couplings (wheat and yeast, starch and heat) that give us our daily bread. Try not to eat a slice.
433.author: Peter Reinhart
433.keywords: TED, talks, art, chemistry, food, life, love, science, Best of the Web

434.title: What consumers want
434.description: Customers want to feel what they buy is authentic, but "Mass Customization" author Joseph Pine says selling authenticity is tough because, well, there's no such thing. He talks about a few experiences that may be artificial but make millions anyway.
434.author: Joseph Pine
434.keywords: TED, talks, business, consumerism, creativity, shopping

435.title: Great design is serious, not solemn
435.description: Paula Scher looks back at a life in design (she's done album covers, books, the Citibank logo ...) and pinpoints the moment when she started really having fun. Look for gorgeous designs and images from her legendary career.
435.author: Paula Scher
435.keywords: TED, talks, art, design, entertainment, happiness, typography, Best of the Web

436.title: Design and discovery
436.description: Great design is a never-ending journey of discovery -- for which it helps to pack a healthy sense of humor. Sociologist and surfer-turned-designer David Carson walks through a gorgeous (and often quite funny) slide deck of his work and found images.
436.author: David Carson
436.keywords: TED, talks, design, exploration, humor, photography, typography

437.title: Genomics 101
437.description: What is genomics? How will it affect our lives? In this intriguing primer on the genomics revolution, entrepreneur Barry Schuler says we can at least expect healthier, tastier food. He suggests we start with the pinot noir grape, to build better wines.
437.author: Barry Schuler
437.keywords: TED, talks, biology, entrepreneur, food, genetics, science, technology

439.title: Tools for a better world
439.description: We all want to make the world better -- but how? Jamais Cascio looks at some specific tools and techniques that can make a difference. It's a fascinating talk that might just inspire you to act.
439.author: Jamais Cascio
439.keywords: TED, talks, culture, future, global issues, social change, technology

440.title: A theory of Earth's mass extinctions
440.description: Asteroid strikes get all the coverage, but "Medea Hypothesis" author Peter Ward argues that most of Earth's mass extinctions were caused by lowly bacteria. The culprit, a poison called hydrogen sulfide, may have an interesting application in medicine.
440.author: Peter Ward
440.keywords: TED, talks, dinosaurs, disease, environment, history, life, science, space

441.title: The extraordinary power of ordinary people
441.description: Sherwin Nuland, a surgeon and a writer, meditates on the idea of hope -- the desire to become our better selves and make a better world. It's a thoughtful 12 minutes that will help you focus on the road ahead.
441.author: Sherwin Nuland

442.title: Hypersonic sound and other inventions
442.description: Woody Norris shows off two of his inventions that use sound in new ways, including the Long Range Acoustic Device, or LRAD. He talks about his untraditional approach to inventing and education, because, as he puts it: "Almost nothing has been invented yet." So -- what's next?
442.author: Woody Norris
442.keywords: TED, talks, business, creativity, design, invention, technology

443.title: Changing my legs - and my mindset
443.description: In this TED archive video from 1998, paralympic sprinter Aimee Mullins talks about her record-setting career as a runner, and about the amazing carbon-fiber prosthetic legs (then a prototype) that helped her cross the finish line.
443.author: Aimee Mullins
443.keywords: TED, talks, beauty, body language, design, prosthetics, sports, technology, bionics

445.title: Solving medical mysteries
445.description: Biochemist Joe DeRisi talks about amazing new ways to diagnose viruses (and treat the illnesses they cause) using DNA. His work may help us understand malaria, SARS, avian flu -- and the 60 percent of everyday viral infections that go undiagnosed.
445.author: Joe DeRisi
445.keywords: TED, talks, global issues, illness, medicine, science, technology, virus

447.title: Fiddling in reel time
447.description: Natalie MacMaster and her musical partner Donnell Leahy play several tunes from the Cape Breton tradition -- a sprightly, soulful style of folk fiddling. It's an inspired collaboration that will have you clapping (and maybe dancing) along.
447.author: Natalie MacMaster
447.keywords: TED, talks, collaboration, culture, entertainment, music, piano, violin, live music, performance

451.title: Mosquitos, malaria and education
451.description: Bill Gates hopes to solve some of the world's biggest problems using a new kind of philanthropy. In a passionate and, yes, funny 18 minutes, he asks us to consider two big questions and how we might answer them. (And see the Q&A on the TED Blog.)
451.author: Bill Gates
451.keywords: TED, talks, business, education, health, illness, insects, philanthropy, science, technology

455.title: Using design to make ideas new
455.description: From the TED archives: The legendary graphic designer Milton Glaser dives deep into a new painting inspired by Piero della Francesca. From here, he muses on what makes a convincing poster, by breaking down an idea and making it new.
455.author: Milton Glaser
455.keywords: TED, talks, art, communication, creativity, culture, design

457.title: Toy tiles that talk to each other
457.description: MIT grad student David Merrill demos Siftables -- cookie-sized, computerized tiles you can stack and shuffle in your hands. These future-toys can do math, play music, and talk to their friends, too. Is this the next thing in hands-on learning?
457.author: David Merrill
457.keywords: TED, talks, art, business, children, computers, design, education, invention, music, technology, toy

462.title: Our loss of wisdom
462.description: Barry Schwartz makes a passionate call for "practical wisdom" as an antidote to a society gone mad with bureaucracy. He argues powerfully that rules often fail us, incentives often backfire, and practical, everyday wisdom will help rebuild our world.
462.author: Barry Schwartz
462.keywords: TED, talks, business, culture, global issues, philosophy, self, social change, society, psychology

463.title: The next species of human
463.description: While the mega-banks were toppling in early 2009, Juan Enriquez took the stage to say: The really big reboot is yet to come. But don't look for it on the stock exchange or the political ballot. It'll come from science labs, and it promises keener bodies and minds. Our kids are going to be ... different.
463.author: Juan Enriquez
463.keywords: TED, talks, biology, business, economics, robots, science, technology

464.title: The El Sistema music revolution
464.description: José Antonio Abreu is the charismatic founder of a youth orchestra system that has transformed thousands of kids' lives in Venezuela. He shares his amazing story and unveils a TED Prize wish that could have a big impact in the US and beyond.
464.author: José Antonio Abreu
464.keywords: TED, talks, conducting, culture, education, entertainment, music, philanthropy, poverty

467.title: My wish: Protect our oceans
467.description: Legendary ocean researcher Sylvia Earle shares astonishing images of the ocean -- and shocking stats about its rapid decline -- as she makes her TED Prize wish: that we will join her in protecting the vital blue heart of the planet.
467.author: Sylvia Earle
467.keywords: TED, talks, TED Prize, activism, biodiversity, exploration, oceans, science, submarine, marine biology, global commons

468.title: Join the SETI search
468.description: The SETI Institute's Jill Tarter makes her TED Prize wish: to accelerate our search for cosmic company. Using a growing array of radio telescopes, she and her team listen for patterns that may be a sign of intelligence elsewhere in the universe.
468.author: Jill Tarter
468.keywords: TED, talks, TED Prize, exploration, extraterrestrial life, intelligence, science, space, universe, telescopes

469.title: How Benjamin Button got his face
469.description: Ed Ulbrich, the digital-effects guru from Digital Domain, explains the Oscar-winning technology that allowed his team to digitally create the older versions of Brad Pitt's face for "The Curious Case of Benjamin Button."
469.author: Ed Ulbrich
469.keywords: TED, talks, aging, business, entertainment, film, technology, animation

470.title: Seas of plastic
470.description: Capt. Charles Moore of the Algalita Marine Research Foundation first discovered the Great Pacific Garbage Patch -- an endless floating waste of plastic trash. Now he's drawing attention to the growing, choking problem of plastic debris in our seas.
470.author: Charles Moore
470.keywords: TED, talks, business, environment, oceans, plastic, science

472.title: My underground art explorations
472.description: At the 2008 EG Conference, artist Miru Kim talks about her work. Kim explores industrial ruins underneath New York and then photographs herself in them, nude -- to bring these massive, dangerous, hidden spaces into sharp focus.
472.author: Miru Kim
472.keywords: TED, talks, art, beauty, cities, entertainment, exploration, photography, Best of the Web

473.title: The voices of Twitter users
473.description: In the year leading up to this talk, the web tool Twitter exploded in size (up 10x during 2008 alone). Co-founder Evan Williams reveals that many of the ideas driving that growth came from unexpected uses invented by the users themselves.
473.author: Evan Williams
473.keywords: TED, talks, business, communication, culture, entertainment, social change, social media, technology

474.title: Why not make video games for girls?
474.description: At TED in 1998, Brenda Laurel asks: Why are all the top-selling videogames aimed at little boys? She spent two years researching the world of girls (and shares amazing interviews and photos) to create a game that girls would love.
474.author: Brenda Laurel
474.keywords: TED, talks, children, culture, design, entertainment, gaming, technology, women, history

475.title: How to restore a rainforest
475.description: By piecing together a complex ecological puzzle, biologist Willie Smits believes he has found a way to re-grow clearcut rainforest in Borneo, saving local orangutans — and creating a thrilling blueprint for restoring fragile ecosystems. NOTE: The core content of this talk has been challenged on a number of grounds. For details, and Willie Smits' response, please see "A challenge to Willie Smits' talk" below.
475.author: Willie Smits
475.keywords: TED, talks, animals, biodiversity, global issues, green, science, trees, plants, ecology, fungi

476.title: Conserving the canopy
476.description: A unique ecosystem of plants, birds and monkeys thrives in the treetops of the rainforest. Nalini Nadkarni explores these canopy worlds -- and shares her findings with the world below, through dance, art and bold partnerships.
476.author: Nalini Nadkarni
476.keywords: TED, talks, activism, animals, biodiversity, biology, children, environment, insects, trees, plants, ecology

480.title: 3 ways good design makes you happy
480.description: In this talk from 2003, design critic Don Norman turns his incisive eye toward beauty, fun, pleasure and emotion, as he looks at design that makes people happy. He names the three emotional cues that a well-designed product must hit to succeed.
480.author: Don Norman

482.title: My 12 pairs of legs
482.description: Athlete, actor and activist Aimee Mullins talks about her prosthetic legs -- she's got a dozen amazing pairs -- and the superpowers they grant her: speed, beauty, an extra 6 inches of height ... Quite simply, she redefines what the body can be.
482.author: Aimee Mullins
482.keywords: TED, talks, activism, design, fashion, future, prosthetics, sports, technology, bionics

483.title: Play is more than just fun
483.description: A pioneer in research on play, Dr. Stuart Brown says humor, games, roughhousing, flirtation and fantasy are more than just fun. Plenty of play in childhood makes for happy, smart adults -- and keeping it up can make us smarter at any age.
483.author: Stuart Brown
483.keywords: TED, talks, brain, children, education, entertainment, gaming, happiness, health, play, psychology, science, Best of the Web

484.title: The next web
484.description: 20 years ago, Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web. For his next project, he's building a web for open, linked data that could do for numbers what the Web did for words, pictures, video: unlock our data and reframe the way we use it together.
484.author: Tim Berners-Lee
484.keywords: TED, talks, business, communication, design, invention, technology, web

485.title: Cute, sexy, sweet, funny
485.description: Why are babies cute? Why is cake sweet? Philosopher Dan Dennett has answers you wouldn't expect, as he shares evolution's counterintuitive reasoning on cute, sweet and sexy things (plus a new theory from Matthew Hurley on why jokes are funny).
485.author: Dan Dennett
485.keywords: TED, talks, animals, biology, children, comedy, evolution, food, humanity, humor, primates, sex

487.title: Our buggy moral code
487.description: Behavioral economist Dan Ariely studies the bugs in our moral code: the hidden reasons we think it's OK to cheat or steal (sometimes). Clever studies help make his point that we're predictably irrational -- and can be influenced in ways we can't grasp.
487.author: Dan Ariely
487.keywords: TED, talks, brain, culture, economics, evil, motivation, psychology, science, self, society

488.title: My obsession with objects and the stories they tell
488.description: Adam Savage talks about his fascination with the dodo bird, and how it led him on a strange and surprising double quest. It's an entertaining adventure through the mind of a creative obsessive.
488.author: Adam Savage
488.keywords: TED, talks, animals, art, birds, creativity, entertainment, exploration, film, technology, Best of the Web

489.title: What is retro-futurism?
489.description: Bruce McCall paints a retro-future that never happened -- full of flying cars, polo-playing tanks and the RMS Tyrannic, "The Biggest Thing in All the World." At Serious Play '08, he narrates a brisk and funny slideshow of his faux-nostalgic art.
489.author: Bruce McCall
489.keywords: TED, talks, art, entertainment, humor, media, Best of the Web

490.title: How to grow fresh air
490.description: Researcher Kamal Meattle shows how an arrangement of three common houseplants, used in specific spots in a home or office building, can result in measurably cleaner indoor air.
490.author: Kamal Meattle
490.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, cities, environment, garden, science, technology, plants

492.title: High-altitude wind energy from kites!
492.description: In this brief talk, Saul Griffith unveils the invention his new company Makani Power has been working on: giant kite turbines that create surprising amounts of clean, renewable energy.
492.author: Saul Griffith
492.keywords: TED, talks, alternative energy, energy, engineering, environment, future, wind energy

494.title: An escape from poverty
494.description: Jacqueline Novogratz tells a moving story of  an encounter in a Nairobi slum with Jane, a former prostitute, whose dreams of escaping poverty, of becoming a doctor and of getting married were fulfilled in an unexpected way.
494.author: Jacqueline Novogratz
494.keywords: TED, talks, activism, business, culture, global issues, poverty, women, work

499.title: The jungle search for viruses
499.description: Virus hunter Nathan Wolfe is outwitting the next pandemic by staying two steps ahead: discovering deadly new viruses where they first emerge -- passing from animals to humans among poor subsistence hunters in Africa -- before they claim millions of lives.
499.author: Nathan Wolfe
499.keywords: TED, talks, AIDS, Africa, bacteria, biodiversity, biology, disease, exploration, global issues, health, microbiology, science

500.title: Poetry of youth and age
500.description: Poet C.K. Williams reads his work at TED2001. As he colors scenes of childhood resentments, college loves, odd neighbors and the literal death of youth, he reminds us of the unique challenges of living.
500.author: C.K. Williams
500.keywords: TED, talks, culture, entertainment, literature, poetry, society, storytelling, writing

501.title: Can design save newspapers?
501.description: Jacek Utko is an extraordinary Polish newspaper designer whose redesigns for papers in Eastern Europe not only win awards, but increase circulation by up to 100%. Can good design save the newspaper? It just might.
501.author: Jacek Utko
501.keywords: TED, talks, business, creativity, culture, design, media, typography

502.title: Extreme wingsuit flying
502.description: Wingsuit jumping is the leading edge of extreme sports -- an exhilarating feat of almost unbelievable daring, where skydivers soar through canyons at over 100MPH. Ueli Gegenschatz talks about how (and why) he does it, and shows jawdropping film.
502.author: Ueli Gegenschatz
502.keywords: TED, talks, adventure, design, entertainment, exploration, extreme sports, flight, invention, sports, technology

503.title: The Airstream, restyled
503.description: In this low-key, image-packed talk from 2002, designer Christopher C. Deam talks about his makeover of an American classic: the Airstream travel trailer.
503.author: Christopher C. Deam
503.keywords: TED, talks, creativity, design, exploration, materials, transportation

504.title: Military robots and the future of war
504.description: In this powerful talk, P.W. Singer shows how the widespread use of robots in war is changing the realities of combat. He shows us scenarios straight out of science fiction -- that now may not be so fictitious.
504.author: P.W. Singer
504.keywords: TED, talks, design, drones, future, global issues, robots, technology, violence, war

506.title: Scenes from "My Architect"
506.description: Nathaniel Kahn shares clips from his documentary "My Architect," about his quest to understand his father, the legendary architect Louis Kahn. It's a film with meaning to anyone who seeks to understand the relationship between art and love.
506.author: Nathaniel Kahn
506.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, children, design, entertainment, film, storytelling

507.title: A prediction for the future of Iran
507.description: Bruce Bueno de Mesquita uses mathematical analysis to predict (very often correctly) such messy human events as war, political power shifts, Intifada ... After a crisp explanation of how he does it, he offers three predictions on the future of Iran.
507.author: Bruce Bueno de Mesquita
507.keywords: TED, talks, global issues, math, prediction, technology, war

509.title: How bacteria "talk"
509.description: Bonnie Bassler discovered that bacteria "talk" to each other, using a chemical language that lets them coordinate defense and mount attacks. The find has stunning implications for medicine, industry -- and our understanding of ourselves.
509.author: Bonnie Bassler
509.keywords: TED, talks, MacArthur grant, bacteria, biology, communication, disease, evolution, health, human origins, microbiology, science

510.title: A theory of everything
510.description: Philosopher-comedian Emily Levine talks (hilariously) about science, math, society and the way everything connects. She's a brilliant trickster, poking holes in our fixed ideas and bringing hidden truths to light. Settle in and let her ping your brain.
510.author: Emily Levine
510.keywords: TED, talks, cognitive science, comedy, entertainment, humor, philosophy, science, technology

511.title: Our antisocial phone tricks
511.description: In this funny (and actually poignant) 3-minute talk, social strategist Renny Gleeson breaks down our always-on social world -- where the experience we're having right now is less interesting than what we'll tweet about it later.
511.author: Renny Gleeson
511.keywords: TED, talks, communication, social media, society, telecom

512.title: A new ecosystem for electric cars
512.description: Forget about the hybrid auto -- Shai Agassi says it's electric cars or bust if we want to impact emissions. His company, Better Place, has a radical plan to take entire countries oil-free by 2020.
512.author: Shai Agassi
512.keywords: TED, talks, alternative energy, business, cars, energy, global issues, green, technology, infrastructure

515.title: To upgrade is human
515.description: In this prophetic 2003 talk -- just days before Dolly the sheep was stuffed -- biotech ethicist Gregory Stock looked forward to new, more meaningful (and controversial) technologies, like customizable babies, whose adoption might drive human evolution.
515.author: Gregory Stock
515.keywords: TED, talks, biology, biotech, children, evolution, genetics, science, technology

516.title: Stunning data visualization in the AlloSphere
516.description: JoAnn Kuchera-Morin demos the AlloSphere, a new way to see, hear and interpret scientific data. Dive into the brain, feel electron spin, hear the music of the elements ... and detect previously unseen patterns that could lead to new discoveries.
516.author: JoAnn Kuchera-Morin
516.keywords: TED, talks, art, math, science, technology, visualizations

517.title: Smash fear, learn anything
517.description: From the EG conference: Productivity guru Tim Ferriss' fun, encouraging anecdotes show how one simple question -- "What's the worst that could happen?" -- is all you need to learn to do anything.
517.author: Tim Ferriss
517.keywords: TED, talks, dance, fear, language, life, productivity, work, Best of the Web

518.title: 9 life lessons from rock climbing
518.description: In this talk from TED University 2009, veteran rock climber Matthew Childs shares nine pointers for rock climbing. These handy tips bear on an effective life at sea level, too.
518.author: Matthew Childs
518.keywords: TED, talks, adventure, entertainment, environment, nature

519.title: The beautiful math of coral
519.description: Margaret Wertheim leads a project to re-create the creatures of the coral reefs using a crochet technique invented by a mathematician -- celebrating the amazements of the reef, and deep-diving into the hyperbolic geometry underlying coral creation.
519.author: Margaret Wertheim
519.keywords: TED, talks, art, design, math, oceans, science, visualizations, marine biology, coral reefs

520.title: Rethinking the way we sit down
520.description: Design legend Niels Diffrient talks about his life in industrial design (and the reason he became a designer instead of a jet pilot). He details his quest to completely rethink the office chair starting from one fundamental data set: the human body.
520.author: Niels Diffrient
520.keywords: TED, talks, business, design, technology, work

521.title: Does racism affect how you vote?
521.description: Nate Silver has data that answers big questions about race in politics. For instance, in the 2008 presidential race, did Obama's skin color actually keep him from getting votes in some parts of the country? Stats and myths collide in this fascinating talk that ends with a remarkable insight.
521.author: Nate Silver
521.keywords: TED, talks, cities, politics, race, statistics, urban planning

523.title: Reporting crisis via texting
523.description: At TEDU 2009, Erik Hersman presents the remarkable story of Ushahidi, a GoogleMap mashup that allowed Kenyans to report and track violence via cell phone texts following the 2008 elections, and has evolved to continue saving lives in other countries.
523.author: Erik Hersman
523.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, activism, communication, disaster relief, global issues, technology

524.title: Comics of bygone New York
524.description: In this captivating talk from the TED archive, cartoonist Ben Katchor reads from his comic strips. These perceptive, surreal stories find the profound hopes and foibles of history (and modern New York) preserved in objects like light switches and signs.
524.author: Ben Katchor
524.keywords: TED, talks, New York, art, cities, humor, books, comedy

525.title: How ideas trump crises
525.description: The "dismal science" truly shines in this optimistic talk, as economist Alex Tabarrok argues free trade and globalization are shaping our once-divided world into a community of idea-sharing more healthy, happy and prosperous than anyone's predictions.
525.author: Alex Tabarrok
525.keywords: TED, talks, business, china, cities, culture, economics, future, global issues, happiness, health, history

526.title: Growing evidence of brain plasticity
526.description: Neuroscientist Michael Merzenich looks at one of the secrets of the brain's incredible power: its ability to actively re-wire itself. He's researching ways to harness the brain's plasticity to enhance our skills and recover lost function.
526.author: Michael Merzenich
526.keywords: TED, talks, brain, computers, consciousness, entrepreneur, mind

527.title: A one-woman global village
527.description: In this hilariously lively performance, actress Sarah Jones channels an opinionated elderly Jewish woman, a fast-talking Dominican college student and more, giving TED2009 just a sample of her spectacular character range.
527.author: Sarah Jones
527.keywords: TED, talks, culture, humanity, humor, identity, performance, storytelling, theater

529.title: Lessons from the 1918 flu
529.description: In 2007, as the world worried about a possible avian flu epidemic, Laurie Garrett, author of "The Coming Plague," gave this powerful talk to a small TED University audience. Her insights from past pandemics are suddenly more relevant than ever.
529.author: Laurie Garrett
529.keywords: TED, talks, Vaccines, business, ebola, health, health care, history, technology

531.title: What went wrong at the LHC
531.description: In this short talk from TED U 2009, Brian Cox shares what's new with the CERN supercollider. He covers the repairs now underway and what the future holds for the largest science experiment ever attempted.
531.author: Brian Cox
531.keywords: TED, talks, astronomy, energy, exploration, physics, science, technology, quantum physics

532.title: The mathematics of war
532.description: By analyzing raw data on violent incidents in the Iraq war and others, Sean Gourley and his team claim to have found a surprisingly strong mathematical relationship linking the fatality and frequency of attacks.
532.author: Sean Gourley
532.keywords: TED, talks, TED Fellows, math, physics, war

534.title: Anti-gravity sculpture
534.description: Tom Shannon shows off his gravity-defying, otherworldly sculpture -- made of simple, earthly materials -- that floats and spins like planets on magnets and suspension wire. It's science-inspired art at its most heavenly.
534.author: Tom Shannon
534.keywords: TED, talks, TED Prize, art, design, engineering, space, science and art

535.title: What comes after An Inconvenient Truth?
535.description: At TED2009, Al Gore presents updated slides from around the globe to make the case that worrying climate trends are even worse than scientists predicted, and to make clear his stance on "clean coal."
535.author: Al Gore
535.keywords: TED, talks, alternative energy, climate change, energy, environment, presentation, science, technology, ecology, sustainability, natural resources

537.title: We need to feed the whole world
537.description: Louise Fresco shows us why we should celebrate mass-produced, supermarket-style white bread. She says environmentally sound mass production will feed the world, yet leave a role for small bakeries and traditional methods.
537.author: Louise Fresco
537.keywords: TED, talks, business, food, global issues, industrial design, consumerism, agriculture, global development, sustainability, activism

538.title: The tribes we lead
538.description: Seth Godin argues the Internet has ended mass marketing and revived a human social unit from the distant past: tribes. Founded on shared ideas and values, tribes give ordinary people the power to lead and make big change. He urges us to do so.
538.author: Seth Godin
538.keywords: TED, talks, communication, community, marketing, social media, society, books, leadership

540.title: Insights on HIV, in stunning data visuals
540.description: Hans Rosling unveils data visuals that untangle the complex risk factors of one of the world's deadliest (and most misunderstood) diseases: HIV. By following the data, he suggests a surprising key to ending the epidemic.
540.author: Hans Rosling
540.keywords: TED, talks, AIDS, Africa, disease, global issues, presentation, statistics, visualizations, HIV

545.title: Ideas for India's future
545.description: Nandan Nilekani, the visionary co-founder of outsourcing pioneer Infosys, explains four brands of ideas that will determine whether India can continue its recent breakneck progress.
545.author: Nandan Nilekani
545.keywords: TED, talks, business, economics, global issues, india, politics, potential, technology, infrastructure, Asia, global development, innovation, future

547.title: The business logic of sustainability
547.description: At his carpet company, Ray Anderson has increased sales and doubled profits while turning the traditional "take / make / waste" industrial system on its head. In a gentle, understated way, he shares a powerful vision for sustainable commerce.
547.author: Ray Anderson
547.keywords: TED, talks, business, design, environment, green, materials, poetry, sustainability, technology

551.title: Could a Saturn moon harbor life?
551.description: Carolyn Porco shares exciting new findings from the Cassini spacecraft's recent sweep of one of Saturn's moons, Enceladus. Samples gathered from the moon's icy geysers hint that an ocean under its surface could harbor life.
551.author: Carolyn Porco
551.keywords: TED, talks, Planets, astronomy, exploration, life, science, space, technology, solar system

553.title: Don't eat the marshmallow!
553.description: In this short talk from TED U, Joachim de Posada shares a landmark experiment on delayed gratification -- and how it can predict future success. With priceless video of kids trying their hardest not to eat the marshmallow.
553.author: Joachim de Posada
553.keywords: TED, talks, children, culture, humor, psychology

555.title: A passionate, personal case for education
555.description: Speaking to an audience of students, US First Lady Michelle Obama reminds each one to take their education seriously -- and never take it for granted. This new, brilliant generation, she tells us, is the one that could close the gap between the world as it is and the world as it should be.
555.author: Michelle Obama
555.keywords: TED, talks, culture, education, global issues, politics, women, Best of the Web

556.title: Why we're storing billions of seeds
556.description: In this brief talk from TED U 2009, Jonathan Drori encourages us to save biodiversity -- one seed at a time. Reminding us that plants support human life, he shares the vision of the Millennium Seed Bank, which has stored over 3 billion seeds to date from dwindling yet essential plant species.
556.author: Jonathan Drori
556.keywords: TED, talks, biodiversity, biology, environment, future, garden, life, science, ecology, plants

558.title: A call to reinvent liberal arts education
558.description: Bennington president Liz Coleman delivers a call-to-arms for radical reform in higher education. Bucking the trend to push students toward increasingly narrow areas of study, she proposes a truly cross-disciplinary education -- one that dynamically combines all areas of study to address the great problems of our day.
558.author: Liz Coleman
558.keywords: TED, talks, activism, collaboration, creativity, education, future, social change

560.title: A university for the coming singularity
560.description: Ray Kurzweil's latest graphs show that technology's breakneck advances will only accelerate -- recession or not. He unveils his new project, Singularity University, to study oncoming tech and guide it to benefit humanity.
560.author: Ray Kurzweil
560.keywords: TED, talks, computers, education, future, nanoscale, prediction, science, technology

561.title: A wide-angle view of fragile Earth
561.description: In this image-filled talk, Yann Arthus-Bertrand displays his three most recent projects on humanity and our habitat -- stunning aerial photographs in his series "The Earth From Above," personal interviews from around the globe featured in his web project "6 billion Others," and his soon-to-be-released movie, "Home," which documents human impact on the environment through breathtaking video.
561.author: Yann Arthus-Bertrand
561.keywords: TED, talks, art, climate change, environment, film, future, humanity, media, photography

562.title: Odes to vice and consequences
562.description: Media big shot Felix Dennis roars his fiery, funny, sometimes racy original poetry, revisiting haunting memories and hard-won battle scars from a madcap -- yet not too repentant -- life. Best enjoyed with a glass of wine.
562.author: Felix Dennis
562.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, history, literature, poetry, writing, books

563.title: The world in 2200
563.description: In this short, optimistic talk from TED2009, Pete Alcorn shares a vision of the world of two centuries from now -- when declining populations and growing opportunity prove Malthus was wrong.
563.author: Pete Alcorn

565.title: Eco-friendly drywall
565.description: Kevin Surace suggests we rethink basic construction materials -- such as the familiar wallboard -- to reduce the huge carbon footprint generated by the manufacturing and construction of our buildings. He introduces EcoRock, a clean, recyclable and energy-efficient drywall created by his team at Serious Materials.
565.author: Kevin Surace
565.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, business, demo, design, green, invention, technology

566.title: A plug for smart power outlets
566.description: John La Grou unveils an ingenious new technology that will smarten up the electrical outlets in our homes, using microprocessors and RFID tags. The invention, Safeplug, promises to prevent deadly accidents like house fires -- and to conserve energy.
566.author: John La Grou
566.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, children, design, energy, technology, electricity

570.title: Happiness and its surprises
570.description: Cognitive researcher Nancy Etcoff looks at happiness -- the ways we try to achieve and increase it, the way it's untethered to our real circumstances, and its surprising effect on our bodies.
570.author: Nancy Etcoff
570.keywords: TED, talks, beauty, culture, happiness, neuroscience, psychology, evolutionary psychology, emotions

571.title: Learning from the gecko's tail
571.description: Biologist Robert Full studies the amazing gecko, with its supersticky feet and tenacious climbing skill. But high-speed footage reveals that the gecko's tail harbors perhaps the most surprising talents of all.
571.author: Robert Full
571.keywords: TED, talks, animals, biology, biomechanics, design, materials, robots, technology

572.title: Success is a continuous journey
572.description: In his typically candid style, Richard St. John reminds us that success is not a one-way street, but a constant journey. He uses the story of his business' rise and fall to illustrate a valuable lesson -- when we stop trying, we fail.
572.author: Richard St. John
572.keywords: TED, talks, business, humor, life, productivity, psychology, success

573.title: Life in Biosphere 2
573.description: Jane Poynter tells her story of living two years and 20 minutes in Biosphere 2 -- an experience that provoked her to explore how we might sustain life in the harshest of environments.
573.author: Jane Poynter
573.keywords: TED, talks, TEDx, adventure, biotech, climate change, environment, space, ecology

578.title: How cults rewire the brain
578.description: Diane Benscoter spent five years as a "Moonie." She shares an insider's perspective on the mind of a cult member, and proposes a new way to think about today's most troubling conflicts and extremist movements.
578.author: Diane Benscoter
578.keywords: TED, talks, God, activism, faith, meme, religion

580.title: Surgery's past, present and robotic future
580.description: Surgeon and inventor Catherine Mohr tours the history of surgery (and its pre-painkiller, pre-antiseptic past), then demos some of the newest tools for surgery through tiny incisions, performed using nimble robot hands. Fascinating -- but not for the squeamish.
580.author: Catherine Mohr
580.keywords: TED, talks, design, health care, heart health, medicine, science, technology

582.title: The psychology of time
582.description: Psychologist Philip Zimbardo says happiness and success are rooted in a trait most of us disregard: the way we orient toward the past, present and future. He suggests we calibrate our outlook on time as a first step to improving our lives.
582.author: Philip Zimbardo
582.keywords: TED, talks, brain, business, happiness, mind, psychology, science

584.title: New rules for rebuilding a broken nation
584.description: Long conflict can wreck a country, leaving behind poverty and chaos. But what's the right way to help war-torn countries rebuild? At TED@State, Paul Collier explains the problems with current post-conflict aid plans, and suggests 3 ideas for a better approach.
584.author: Paul Collier
584.keywords: TED, talks, global issues, money, politics, poverty, state-building

585.title: You are the future of philanthropy
585.description: In this uplifting talk, Katherine Fulton sketches the new future of philanthropy -- one where collaboration and innovation allow regular people to do big things, even when money is scarce. Giving five practical examples of crowd-driven philanthropy, she calls for a new generation of citizen leaders.
585.author: Katherine Fulton
585.keywords: TED, talks, activism, community, global issues, philanthropy, potential

586.title: My trek to the South Pole
586.description: Extreme runner Ray Zahab shares an enthusiastic account of his record-breaking trek on foot to the South Pole -- a 33-day sprint through the snow.
586.author: Ray Zahab

587.title: Teach statistics before calculus!
587.description: Someone always asks the math teacher, "Am I going to use calculus in real life?" And for most of us, says Arthur Benjamin, the answer is no. He offers a bold proposal on how to make math education relevant in the digital age.
587.author: Arthur Benjamin
587.keywords: TED, talks, economics, education, math, statistics

588.title: Life lessons through tinkering
588.description: Gever Tulley uses engaging photos and footage to demonstrate the valuable lessons kids learn at his Tinkering School. When given tools, materials and guidance, these young imaginations run wild and creative problem-solving takes over to build unique boats, bridges and even a roller coaster!
588.author: Gever Tulley
588.keywords: TED, talks, children, education, innovation, invention, creativity, design

589.title: 17 words of architectural inspiration
589.description: Daniel Libeskind builds on very big ideas. Here, he shares 17 words that underlie his vision for architecture -- raw, risky, emotional, radical -- and that offer inspiration for any bold creative pursuit.
589.author: Daniel Libeskind
589.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, cities, creativity, design, technology

590.title: The design genius of Charles + Ray Eames
590.description: The legendary design team Charles and Ray Eames made films, houses and classic midcentury modern furniture. Eames Demetrios, their grandson, shows rarely seen films and archival footage in a lively, loving tribute to their creative process.
590.author: Eames Demetrios
590.keywords: TED, talks, children, creativity, design, film, product design

591.title: 3 ways the brain creates meaning
591.description: Information designer Tom Wujec talks through three areas of the brain that help us understand words, images, feelings, connections. In this short talk from TEDU, he asks: How can we best engage our brains to help us better understand big ideas?
591.author: Tom Wujec
591.keywords: TED, talks, brain, creativity, design, presentation, technology, visualizations

592.title: Escaping the Khmer Rouge
592.description: TED Fellow Sophal Ear shares the compelling story of his family's escape from Cambodia under the rule of the Khmer Rouge. He recounts his mother's cunning and determination to save her children.
592.author: Sophal Ear
592.keywords: TED, talks, Asia, adventure, storytelling, war, history

594.title: A next-gen cure for killer infections
594.description: (NOTE: This talk was given in 2009, and this field of science has developed quickly since then. Read "Criticisms & updates" below for more details.) Drug-resistant bacteria kills, even in top hospitals. But now tough infections like staph and anthrax may be in for a surprise. Nobel-winning chemist Kary Mullis, who watched a friend die when powerful antibiotics failed, unveils a radical new cure that shows extraordinary promise.
594.author: Kary Mullis
594.keywords: TED, talks, biology, chemistry, disease, health, health care, medicine, science, technology

598.title: 4 environmental 'heresies'
598.description: The man who helped usher in the environmental movement in the 1960s and '70s has been rethinking his positions on cities, nuclear power, genetic modification and geo-engineering. This talk at the US State Department is a foretaste of his major new book, sure to provoke widespread debate.
598.author: Stewart Brand
598.keywords: TED, talks, alternative energy, climate change, environment, future, global issues, green, sustainability, urban planning, global development, Anthropocene, electricity

599.title: Playing with space and light
599.description: In the spectacular large-scale projects he's famous for (such as "Waterfalls" in New York harbor), Olafur Eliasson creates art from a palette of space, distance, color and light. This idea-packed talk begins with an experiment in the nature of perception.
599.author: Olafur Eliasson

601.title: A better way to harvest bone marrow
601.description: Daniel Kraft demos his Marrow Miner -- a new device that quickly harvests life-saving bone marrow with minimal pain to the donor. He emphasizes that the adult stem cells found in bone marrow can be used to treat many terminal conditions, from Parkinson's to heart disease.
601.author: Daniel Kraft
601.keywords: TED, talks, biology, biotech, health, health care, medicine, science, technology

602.title: Exploring the mind of a killer
602.description: Psychopathic killers are the basis for some must-watch TV, but what really makes them tick? Neuroscientist Jim Fallon talks about brain scans and genetic analysis that may uncover the rotten wiring in the nature (and nurture) of murderers. In a too-strange-for-fiction twist, he shares a fascinating family history that makes his work chillingly personal.
602.author: Jim Fallon
602.keywords: TED, talks, brain, consciousness, mental health, mind, psychology, science, violence, genetics, neuroscience, crime

603.title: Skin color is an illusion
603.description: Nina Jablonski says that differing skin colors are simply our bodies' adaptation to varied climates and levels of UV exposure. Charles Darwin disagreed with this theory, but she explains, that's because he did not have access to NASA.
603.author: Nina Jablonski
603.keywords: TED, talks, anthropology, biology, evolution, human origins, humanity, race, science

604.title: Wiring a web for global good
604.description: We're at a unique moment in history, says UK Prime Minister Gordon Brown: we can use today's interconnectedness to develop our shared global ethic -- and work together to confront the challenges of poverty, security, climate change and the economy.
604.author: Gordon Brown
604.keywords: TED, talks, Europe, collaboration, communication, economics, global issues, politics, technology

606.title: Art that looks back at you
606.description: Golan Levin, an artist and engineer, uses modern tools -- robotics, new software, cognitive research -- to make artworks that surprise and delight. Watch as sounds become shapes, bodies create paintings, and a curious eye looks back at the curious viewer.
606.author: Golan Levin
606.keywords: TED, talks, art, creativity, design, poetry, software, technology

607.title: I believe we evolved from aquatic apes
607.description: (NOTE: Statements in this talk have been challenged by scientists working in this field. Read "Criticisms & updates" below for more details.) Elaine Morgan was a tenacious proponent of a theory that is not widely accepted. The aquatic ape hypothesis lays out the idea that humans evolved from primate ancestors who dwelt in watery habitats. Hear her spirited defense of the idea -- and her theory on why science doesn't take it seriously.
607.author: Elaine Morgan

608.title: Why the world needs charter cities
608.description: How can a struggling country break out of poverty if it's trapped in a system of bad rules? Economist Paul Romer unveils a bold idea: "charter cities," city-scale administrative zones governed by a coalition of nations. (Could Guantánamo Bay become the next Hong Kong?)
608.author: Paul Romer
608.keywords: TED, talks, business, cities, culture, economics, global issues, politics

610.title: Hold your breath for micro-sculpture
610.description: Willard Wigan tells the story of how a difficult and lonely childhood drove him to discover his unique ability -- to create art so tiny that it can't be seen with the naked eye. His slideshow of figures, as seen through a microscope, can only be described as mind-boggling.
610.author: Willard Wigan

613.title: How to make filthy water drinkable
613.description: Too much of the world lacks access to clean drinking water. Engineer Michael Pritchard did something about it -- inventing the portable Lifesaver filter, which can make the most revolting water drinkable in seconds. An amazing demo from TEDGlobal 2009.
613.author: Michael Pritchard
613.keywords: TED, talks, business, demo, design, global issues, invention, technology, water

614.title: Biomimicry in action
614.description: Janine Benyus has a message for inventors: When solving a design problem, look to nature first. There you'll find inspired designs for making things waterproof, aerodynamic, solar-powered and more. Here she reveals dozens of new products that take their cue from nature with spectacular results.
614.author: Janine Benyus
614.keywords: TED, talks, biodiversity, biology, biomimicry, biotech, creativity, design, innovation, invention, nature

615.title: The music of a war child
615.description: For five years, young Emmanuel Jal fought as a child soldier in the Sudan. Rescued by an aid worker, he's become an international hip-hop star and an activist for kids in war zones. In words and lyrics, he tells the story of his amazing life.
615.author: Emmanuel Jal
615.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, global issues, music, poetry, politics, war, performance, live music

619.title: A demo of wireless electricity
619.description: Eric Giler wants to untangle our wired lives with cable-free electric power. Here, he covers what this sci-fi tech offers, and demos MIT's breakthrough version, WiTricity -- a near-to-market invention that may soon recharge your cell phone, car, pacemaker.
619.author: Eric Giler
619.keywords: TED, talks, engineering, entrepreneur, future, science, technology, infrastructure, electricity

620.title: Let my dataset change your mindset
620.description: Talking at the US State Department this summer, Hans Rosling uses his fascinating data-bubble software to burst myths about the developing world. Look for new analysis on China and the post-bailout world, mixed with classic data shows.
620.author: Hans Rosling
620.keywords: TED, talks, medicine, presentation, science, technology, data, statistics, global development, math, global issues, Asia, visualizations, Africa

621.title: A multimedia theatrical adventure
621.description: Natasha Tsakos presents part of her one-woman, multimedia show, "Upwake." As the character Zero, she blends dream and reality with an inventive virtual world projected around her in 3D animation and electric sound.
621.author: Natasha Tsakos
621.keywords: TED, talks, media, performance, performance art, storytelling, theater, animation

622.title: One seed at a time, protecting the future of food
622.description: The wheat, corn and rice we grow today may not thrive in a future threatened by climate change. Cary Fowler takes us inside the Svalbard Global Seed Vault, a vast treasury buried within a frozen mountain in Norway, that stores a diverse group of food-crop seeds ... for whatever tomorrow may bring.
622.author: Cary Fowler
622.keywords: TED, talks, agriculture, biodiversity, climate change, disaster relief, environment, food, garden, plants, ecology, Anthropocene

623.title: Adjustable liquid-filled eyeglasses
623.description: Josh Silver delivers his brilliantly simple solution for correcting vision at the lowest cost possible -- adjustable, liquid-filled lenses. At TEDGlobal 2009, he demos his affordable eyeglasses and reveals his global plan to distribute them to a billion people in need by 2020.
623.author: Joshua Silver
623.keywords: TED, talks, global issues, health, health care, innovation, invention, product design, sight, global development

625.title: Post-crash, investing in a better world
625.description: As we reboot the world's economy, Geoff Mulgan poses a question: Instead of sending bailout money to doomed old industries, why not use stimulus funds to bootstrap some new, socially responsible companies -- and make the world a little bit better?
625.author: Geoff Mulgan
625.keywords: TED, talks, culture, design, health, social change, technology

626.title: Making sound visible through cymatics
626.description: Evan Grant demonstrates the science and art of cymatics, a process for making soundwaves visible. Useful for analyzing complex sounds (like dolphin calls), it also makes complex and beautiful designs.
626.author: Evan Grant
626.keywords: TED, talks, design, math, presentation, science, visualizations

627.title: A leap from the edge of space
627.description: At his day job, Steve Truglia flips cars, walks through fire and falls out of buildings -- pushing technology to make stunts bigger, safer, more awesome. He talks us through his next stunt: the highest jump ever attempted, from the very edge of space.
627.author: Steve Truglia
627.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, film, space, sports, technology

628.title: Time-lapse proof of extreme ice loss
628.description: Photographer James Balog shares new image sequences from the Extreme Ice Survey, a network of time-lapse cameras recording glaciers receding at an alarming rate, some of the most vivid evidence yet of climate change.
628.author: James Balog
628.keywords: TED, talks, climate change, global issues, photography, science, technology

629.title: How I swam the North Pole
629.description: Lewis Pugh talks about his record-breaking swim across the North Pole. He braved the icy waters (in a Speedo) to highlight the melting icecap. Watch for astonishing footage -- and some blunt commentary on the realities of supercold-water swims.
629.author: Lewis Pugh
629.keywords: TED, talks, adventure, climate change, science, sports

630.title: How we read each other's minds
630.description: Sensing the motives and feelings of others is a natural talent for humans. But how do we do it? Here, Rebecca Saxe shares fascinating lab work that uncovers how the brain thinks about other peoples' thoughts -- and judges their actions.
630.author: Rebecca Saxe
630.keywords: TED, talks, brain, morality, science, technology

633.title: The real story of McMafia -- how global crime networks work
633.description: Journalist Misha Glenny spent several years in a courageous investigation of organized crime networks, which have grown to an estimated 15% of the global economy. From the Russian mafia to the giant drug cartels, his sources include not just intelligence and law enforcement officials but criminal insiders.
633.author: Misha Glenny
633.keywords: TED, talks, adventure, crime, economics, global issues, writing, narcotics, journalism

634.title: 3 warp-speed architecture tales
634.description: Danish architect Bjarke Ingels rockets through photo/video-mingled stories of his eco-flashy designs. His buildings not only look like nature -- they act like nature: blocking the wind, collecting solar energy -- and creating stunning views.
634.author: Bjarke Ingels
634.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, cities, creativity, design, environment, green

635.title: An inventory of the invisible
635.description: Nature's mysteries meet tack-sharp wit in this hilarious, 10-minute mix of quips and fun lessons, as comedian, writer and TV man John Lloyd plucks at the substance of several things not seen.
635.author: John Lloyd
635.keywords: TED, talks, comedy, philosophy, science, humor

640.title: The Web as random acts of kindness
640.description: Feeling like the world is becoming less friendly? Social theorist Jonathan Zittrain begs to differ. The Internet, he suggests, is made up of millions of disinterested acts of kindness, curiosity and trust.
640.author: Jonathan Zittrain
640.keywords: TED, talks, Internet, culture, law, technology, web, wikipedia

641.title: How the Net aids dictatorships
641.description: TED Fellow and journalist Evgeny Morozov punctures what he calls "iPod liberalism" -- the assumption that tech innovation always promotes freedom, democracy -- with chilling examples of ways the Internet helps oppressive regimes stifle dissent.
641.author: Evgeny Morozov
641.keywords: TED, talks, Internet, government, politics, technology, web

642.title: How I harnessed the wind
642.description: At age 14, in poverty and famine, a Malawian boy built a windmill to power his family's home. Now at 22, William Kamkwamba, who speaks at TED, here, for the second time, shares in his own words the moving tale of invention that changed his life.
642.author: William Kamkwamba
642.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, creativity, energy, invention, poverty

643.title: Photographs of secret sites
643.description: Taryn Simon exhibits her startling take on photography -- to reveal worlds and people we would never see otherwise. She shares two projects: one documents otherworldly locations typically kept secret from the public, the other involves haunting portraits of men convicted for crimes they did not commit.
643.author: Taryn Simon
643.keywords: TED, talks, adventure, art, culture, curiosity, photography

644.title: A third way to think about aid
644.description: The debate over foreign aid often pits those who mistrust "charity" against those who mistrust reliance on the markets. Jacqueline Novogratz proposes a middle way she calls patient capital, with promising examples of entrepreneurial innovation driving social change.
644.author: Jacqueline Novogratz
644.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, business, economics, global issues, innovation, invention, poverty, women, global development, philanthropy, inequality, markets

645.title: Mapping the future of countries
645.description: Many people think the lines on the map no longer matter, but Parag Khanna says they do. Using maps of the past and present, he explains the root causes of border conflicts worldwide and proposes simple yet cunning solutions for each.
645.author: Parag Khanna
645.keywords: TED, talks, Asia, economics, global issues, history, map, politics, state-building, war, world cultures, infrastructure

646.title: Designers -- think big!
646.description: Tim Brown says the design profession has a bigger role to play than just creating nifty, fashionable little objects. He calls for a shift to local, collaborative, participatory "design thinking" -- starting with the example of 19th-century design thinker Isambard Kingdom Brunel.
646.author: Tim Brown
646.keywords: TED, talks, art, business, design, green, history, product design, graphic design

647.title: Let's revive the Golden Rule
647.description: Weeks from the Charter for Compassion launch, Karen Armstrong looks at religion's role in the 21st century: Will its dogmas divide us? Or will it unite us for common good? She reviews the catalysts that can drive the world's faiths to rediscover the Golden Rule.
647.author: Karen Armstrong
647.keywords: TED, talks, God, TED Prize, global issues, politics, religion, violence

648.title: How spectroscopy could reveal alien life
648.description: Garik Israelian is a spectroscopist, studying the spectrum emitted by a star to figure out what it's made of and how it might behave. It's a rare and accessible look at this discipline, which may be coming close to finding a planet friendly to life.
648.author: Garik Israelian
648.keywords: TED, talks, astronomy, chemistry, life, science, technology, universe, telescopes, Sun

649.title: The power of time off
649.description: Every seven years, designer Stefan Sagmeister closes his New York studio for a yearlong sabbatical to rejuvenate and refresh their creative outlook. He explains the often overlooked value of time off and shows the innovative projects inspired by his time in Bali.
649.author: Stefan Sagmeister
649.keywords: TED, talks, adventure, art, creativity, design, happiness, innovation, work

650.title: How food shapes our cities
