650.description: Every day, in a city the size of London, 30 million meals are served. But where does all the food come from? Architect Carolyn Steel discusses the daily miracle of feeding a city, and shows how ancient food routes shaped the modern world.
650.author: Carolyn Steel
650.keywords: TED, talks, ancient world, cities, culture, food, global issues

651.title: Tribal leadership
651.description: David Logan talks about the five kinds of tribes that humans naturally form -- in schools, workplaces, even the driver's license bureau. By understanding our shared tribal tendencies, we can help lead each other to become better individuals.
651.author: David Logan
651.keywords: TED, talks, TEDx, business, communication, culture, leadership, society, indigenous peoples

654.title: Claim your "manspace"
654.description: Author Sam Martin shares photos of a quirky world hobby that's trending with the XY set: "manspaces." (They're custom-built hangouts where a man can claim a bit of his own territory to work, relax, be himself.) Grab a cold one and enjoy.
654.author: Sam Martin
654.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, culture, design, entertainment, men, books

655.title: New York -- before the City
655.description: 400 years after Hudson found New York harbor, Eric Sanderson shares how he made a 3D map of Mannahatta's fascinating pre-city ecology of hills, rivers, wildlife -- accurate down to the block -- when Times Square was a wetland and you couldn't get delivery.
655.author: Eric Sanderson
655.keywords: TED, talks, cities, environment, history, life, nature, sustainability, technology, visualizations

657.title: Robots that "show emotion"
657.description: David Hanson's robot faces look and act like yours: They recognize and respond to emotion, and make expressions of their own. Here, an "emotional" live demo of the Einstein robot offers a peek at a future where robots truly mimic humans.
657.author: David Hanson
657.keywords: TED, talks, body language, demo, design, engineering, entertainment, robots, technology

658.title: Life lessons from an ad man
658.description: Advertising adds value to a product by changing our perception, rather than the product itself. Rory Sutherland makes the daring assertion that a change in perceived value can be just as satisfying as what we consider “real” value -- and his conclusion has interesting consequences for how we look at life.
658.author: Rory Sutherland
658.keywords: TED, talks, advertising, business, consumerism, creativity, economics, happiness, life, psychology

659.title: A brain in a supercomputer
659.description: Henry Markram says the mysteries of the mind can be solved -- soon. Mental illness, memory, perception: they're made of neurons and electric signals, and he plans to find them with a supercomputer that models all the brain's 100,000,000,000,000 synapses.
659.author: Henry Markram
659.keywords: TED, talks, brain, computers, consciousness, mind, philosophy, technology, neuroscience

662.title: Animating a photo-real digital face
662.description: Computer graphics trailblazer Paul Debevec explains the scene-stealing technology behind Digital Emily, a digitally constructed human face so realistic it stands up to multiple takes.
662.author: Paul Debevec
662.keywords: TED, talks, TEDx, art, computers, design, film, technology, visualizations, animation

663.title: Lead like the great conductors
663.description: An orchestra conductor faces the ultimate leadership challenge: creating perfect harmony without saying a word. In this charming talk, Itay Talgam demonstrates the unique styles of six great 20th-century conductors, illustrating crucial lessons for all leaders.
663.author: Itay Talgam
663.keywords: TED, talks, business, conducting, leadership, music, psychology, society

664.title: 1.3m reasons to re-invent the syringe
664.description: Reuse of syringes, all too common in under-funded clinics, kills 1.3 million each year. Marc Koska clues us in to this devastating global problem with facts, photos and hidden-camera footage. He shares his solution: a low-cost syringe that can't be used twice.
664.author: Marc Koska
664.keywords: TED, talks, design, health, medicine, sanitation, science, technology, global development, Vaccines, biotech

665.title: Navigating our global future
665.description: As globalization and technological advances bring us hurtling towards a new integrated future, Ian Goldin warns that not all people may benefit equally. But, he says, if we can recognize this danger, we might yet realize the possibility of improved life for everyone.
665.author: Ian Goldin
665.keywords: TED, talks, economics, future, global issues, inequality, technology, global development, prediction

666.title: A new way to explain explanation
666.description: For tens of thousands of years our ancestors understood the world through myths, and the pace of change was glacial. The rise of scientific understanding transformed the world within a few centuries. Why? Physicist David Deutsch proposes a subtle answer.
666.author: David Deutsch
666.keywords: TED, talks, ancient world, cosmos, faith, history, philosophy, physics, religion, science, technology

667.title: Architecture that repairs itself?
667.description: Venice is sinking. To save it, Rachel Armstrong says we need to outgrow architecture made of inert materials and, well, make architecture that grows itself. She proposes a not-quite-alive material that does its own repairs and sequesters carbon, too.
667.author: Rachel Armstrong
667.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, art, biology, design, life, science, sustainability, technology, global development, industrial design

669.title: The year I was homeless
669.description: Becky Blanton planned to live in her van for a year and see the country, but when depression set in and her freelance job ended, her camping trip turned into homelessness. In this intimate talk, she describes her experience of becoming one of America's working homeless.
669.author: Becky  Blanton
669.keywords: TED, talks, depression, happiness, life, personal growth, poverty, social change, society, storytelling, homelessness

670.title: Symmetry, reality's riddle
670.description: The world turns on symmetry -- from the spin of subatomic particles to the dizzying beauty of an arabesque. But there's more to it than meets the eye. Here, Oxford mathematician Marcus du Sautoy offers a glimpse of the invisible numbers that marry all symmetrical objects.
670.author: Marcus du Sautoy
670.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, art, beauty, math, physics, universe

673.title: The balancing act of compassion
673.description: While we all agree that compassion is a great idea, Rabbi Tabick acknowledges there are challenges to its execution. She explains how a careful balance of compassion and justice allows us to do good deeds, and keep our sanity.
673.author: Jackie Tabick
673.keywords: TED, talks, charter for compassion, compassion, global issues, religion

674.title: The profound journey of compassion
674.description: Swami Dayananda Saraswati unravels the parallel paths of personal development and attaining true compassion. He walks us through each step of self-realization, from helpless infancy to the fearless act of caring for others.
674.author: Dayananda Saraswati
674.keywords: TED, talks, charter for compassion, compassion, global issues, religion, self

675.title: Compassion at the dinner table
675.description: Join Rev. James Forbes at the dinner table of his Southern childhood, where his mother and father taught him what compassion really means day to day -- sharing with those who need love.
675.author: James Forbes
675.keywords: TED, talks, charter for compassion, compassion, faith, global issues, life, religion

676.title: Lose your ego, find your compassion
676.description: Imam Faisal Abdul Rauf combines the teachings of the Qur'an, the stories of Rumi, and the examples of Muhammad and Jesus, to demonstrate that only one obstacle stands between each of us and absolute compassion -- ourselves.
676.author: Feisal Abdul Rauf
676.keywords: TED, talks, charter for compassion, compassion, global issues, religion

677.title: Expanding your circle of compassion
677.description: It's hard to always show compassion -- even to the people we love, but Robert Thurman asks that we develop compassion for our enemies. He prescribes a seven-step meditation exercise to extend compassion beyond our inner circle.
677.author: Robert Thurman
677.keywords: TED, talks, charter for compassion, compassion, global issues, love, religion, self

679.title: The evolution of compassion
679.description: Robert Wright uses evolutionary biology and game theory to explain why we appreciate the Golden Rule ("Do unto others..."), why we sometimes ignore it and why there’s hope that, in the near future, we might all have the compassion to follow it.
679.author: Robert Wright
679.keywords: TED, talks, charter for compassion, compassion, evolution, global issues

680.title: How the Internet enables intimacy
680.description: We worry that IM, texting, Facebook are spoiling human intimacy, but Stefana Broadbent's research shows how communication tech is capable of cultivating deeper relationships, bringing love across barriers like distance and workplace rules.
680.author: Stefana Broadbent
680.keywords: TED, talks, anthropology, humanity, love, psychology, social media, society, sociology, technology

681.title: The refugees of boom-and-bust
681.description: At TEDGlobal U, Cameron Sinclair shows the unreported cost of real estate megaprojects gone bust: thousands of migrant construction laborers left stranded and penniless. To his fellow architects, he says there is only one ethical response.
681.author: Cameron Sinclair
681.keywords: TED, talks, business, cities, design, global issues, social change, technology

682.title: The science behind a climate headline
682.description: In 4 minutes, atmospheric chemist Rachel Pike provides a glimpse of the massive scientific effort behind the bold headlines on climate change, with her team -- one of thousands who contributed -- taking a risky flight over the rainforest in pursuit of data on a key molecule.
682.author: Rachel Pike
682.keywords: TED, talks, chemistry, climate change, environment, global issues, science, weather

683.title: Photographing the landscape of oil
683.description: In stunning large-format photographs, Edward Burtynsky follows the path of oil through modern society, from wellhead to pipeline to car engine -- and then beyond to the projected peak-oil endgame.
683.author: Edward Burtynsky
683.keywords: TED, talks, TED Prize, design, energy, global issues, photography, technology

684.title: The surprising spread of Idol TV
684.description: Cynthia Schneider looks at two international "American Idol"-style shows -- one in Afghanistan, and one in the United Arab Emirates -- and shows the surprising effect that these reality-TV competitions are creating in their societies.
684.author: Cynthia Schneider
684.keywords: TED, talks, culture, entertainment, global issues, poetry, politics

686.title: East vs. West -- the myths that mystify
686.description: Devdutt Pattanaik takes an eye-opening look at the myths of India and of the West -- and shows how these two fundamentally different sets of beliefs about God, death and heaven help us consistently misunderstand one another.
686.author: Devdutt Pattanaik
686.keywords: TED, talks, business, culture, global issues, india

688.title: Dance to change the world
688.description:
At TEDIndia, Mallika Sarabhai, a dancer/actor/politician, tells a  
transformative story in dance -- and argues that the arts may be the  
most powerful way to effect change, whether political, social or  
personal.
688.author: Mallika Sarabhai
688.keywords: TED, talks, culture, dance, entertainment, global issues, politics, social change

689.title: Why nations should pursue soft power
689.description: India is fast becoming a superpower, says Shashi Tharoor -- not just through trade and politics, but through "soft" power, its ability to share its culture with the world through food, music, technology, Bollywood. He argues that in the long run it's not the size of the army that matters as much as a country's ability to influence the world's hearts and minds.
689.author: Shashi Tharoor
689.keywords: TED, talks, business, culture, entertainment, global issues, india, politics, writing

691.title: Science-inspired design
691.description: Naming science as his chief inspiration, Mathieu Lehanneur shows a selection of his ingenious designs -- an interactive noise-neutralizing ball, an antibiotic course in one layered pill, asthma treatment that reminds kids to take it, a living air filter, a living-room fish farm and more.
691.author: Mathieu Lehanneur
691.keywords: TED, talks, design, disease, green, innovation, nature, product design, science, technology, biomimicry

692.title: Learning from leadership's missing manual
692.description: Leadership doesn't have a user's manual, but Fields Wicker-Miurin says stories of remarkable, local leaders are the next best thing. At a TED salon in London, she shares three.
692.author: Fields Wicker-Miurin
692.keywords: TED, talks, environment, global issues, leadership, politics, women in business

694.title: Learn to use the 13th-century astrolabe
694.description: Rather than demo another new technology, Tom Wujec reaches back to one of our earliest but most ingenious devices -- the astrolabe. With thousands of uses, from telling time to mapping the night sky, this old tech reminds us that the ancient can be as brilliant as the brand-new.
694.author: Tom Wujec
694.keywords: TED, talks, astronomy, history, innovation, science, technology

695.title: Asia's rise -- how and when
695.description: Hans Rosling was a young guest student in India when he first realized that Asia had all the capacities to reclaim its place as the world's dominant economic force. At TEDIndia, he graphs global economic growth since 1858 and predicts the exact date that India and China will outstrip the US.
695.author: Hans Rosling
695.keywords: TED, talks, Asia, economics, health, india, statistics, technology, visualizations

696.title: Transition to a world without oil
696.description: Rob Hopkins reminds us that the oil our world depends on is steadily running out. He proposes a unique solution to this problem -- the Transition response, where we prepare ourselves for life without oil and sacrifice our luxuries to build systems and communities that are completely independent of fossil fuels.
696.author: Rob Hopkins
696.keywords: TED, talks, big problems, cities, energy, environment, future, green, pollution, sustainability, technology, infrastructure

698.title: Turning dunes into architecture
698.description: Architecture student Magnus Larsson details his bold plan to transform the harsh Sahara desert using bacteria and a surprising construction material: the sand itself.
698.author: Magnus Larsson
698.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, architecture, bacteria, biology, design, sustainability, water

701.title: The hunt for a supermassive black hole
701.description: With new data from the Keck telescopes, Andrea Ghez shows how state-of-the-art adaptive optics are helping astronomers understand our universe's most mysterious objects: black holes. She shares evidence that a supermassive black hole may be lurking at the center of the Milky Way.
701.author: Andrea Ghez
701.keywords: TED, talks, astronomy, dark matter, exploration, physics, science, space, technology, telescopes

704.title: The fight against sex slavery
704.description: Sunitha Krishnan has dedicated her life to rescuing women and children from sex slavery, a multimilion-dollar global market. In this courageous talk, she tells three powerful stories, as well as her own, and calls for a more humane approach to helping these young victims rebuild their lives.
704.author: Sunitha Krishnan
704.keywords: TED, talks, Asia, Slavery, children, global issues, poverty, sex, trafficking, women, sexual violence

705.title: The art of puzzles
705.description: At the 2008 EG conference, famed puzzle designer Scott Kim takes us inside the puzzle-maker's frame of mind. Sampling his career's work, he introduces a few of the most popular types, and shares the fascinations that inspired some of his best.
705.author: Scott Kim
705.keywords: TED, talks, art, computers, design, gaming, math, online video, Best of the Web

706.title: A one-man world summit
706.description: Scottish funnyman Rory Bremner convenes a historic council on the TEDGlobal stage -- as he lampoons Gordon Brown, Barack Obama, George W. Bush and a cast of other world leaders with his hilarious impressions and biting commentary. See if you can catch a few sharp TED in-jokes.
706.author: Rory  Bremner
706.keywords: TED, talks, comedy, global issues, government, performance, politics, humor

708.title: The art of the interview
708.description: Marc Pachter has conducted live interviews with some of the most intriguing characters in recent American history as part of a remarkable series created for the Smithsonian's National Portrait Gallery. He reveals the secret to a great interview and shares extraordinary stories of talking with Steve Martin, Clare Booth Luce and more.
708.author: Marc Pachter
708.keywords: TED, talks, art, history, performance, personal growth, Best of the Web

709.title: How low-cost eye care can be world-class
709.description: India's revolutionary Aravind Eye Care System has given sight to millions. Thulasiraj Ravilla looks at the ingenious approach that drives its treatment costs down and quality up, and why its methods should trigger a re-think of all human services.
709.author: Thulasiraj Ravilla
709.keywords: TED, talks, design, health, health care, humanity, medicine, public health, sight, technology

710.title: Pop culture in the Arab world
710.description: Shereen El Feki shows how some Arab cultures are borrowing trademarks of Western pop culture -- music videos, comics, even Barbie -- and adding a culturally appropriate twist. The hybridized media shows how two civilizations, rather than dividing, can dovetail.
710.author: Shereen El Feki
710.keywords: TED, talks, Egypt, culture, entertainment, global issues, media, music

712.title: The intricate economics of terrorism
712.description: Loretta Napoleoni details her rare opportunity to talk to the secretive Italian Red Brigades -- an experience that sparked a lifelong interest in terrorism. She gives a behind-the-scenes look at its complex economics, revealing a surprising connection between money laundering and the US Patriot Act.
712.author: Loretta Napoleoni
712.keywords: TED, talks, corruption, economics, global issues, money, terrorism

713.title: Photographing the hidden story
713.description: Ryan Lobo has traveled the world, taking photographs that tell stories of unusual human lives. In this haunting talk, he reframes controversial subjects with empathy, so that we see the pain of a Liberian war criminal, the quiet strength of UN women peacekeepers and the perseverance of Delhi's underappreciated firefighters.
713.author: Ryan Lobo
713.keywords: TED, talks, Asia, art, humanity, photography, storytelling, war, india

715.title: Dragonflies that fly across oceans
715.description: While living and working as a marine biologist in Maldives, Charles Anderson noticed sudden explosions of dragonflies at certain times of year. He explains how he carefully tracked the path of a plain, little dragonfly called the globe skimmer, only to discover that it had the longest migratory journey of any insect in the world.
715.author: Charles Anderson
715.keywords: TED, talks, biodiversity, biology, birds, insects, science, ecology, india

716.title: Metaphorically speaking
716.description: Aphorism enthusiast and author James Geary waxes on a fascinating fixture of human language: the metaphor. Friend of scribes from Aristotle to Elvis, metaphor can subtly influence the decisions we make, Geary says.
716.author: James Geary
716.keywords: TED, talks, art, language, music, poetry, writing, books

717.title: A new way to fight corruption
717.description: Shaffi Mather explains why he left his first career to become a social entrepreneur, providing life-saving transportation with his company 1298 for Ambulance. Now, he has a new idea and plans to begin a company to fight the booming business of corruption in public service, eliminating it one bribe at a time.
717.author: Shaffi Mather
717.keywords: TED, talks, Asia, TED Fellows, crime, entrepreneur, potential, poverty, social change, society, india

718.title: Fusion is energy's future
718.description: Physicist Steven Cowley is certain that nuclear fusion is the only truly sustainable solution to the fuel crisis. He explains why fusion will work -- and details the projects that he and many others have devoted their lives to, working against the clock to create a new source of energy.
718.author: Steven Cowley
718.keywords: TED, talks, alternative energy, climate change, energy, environment, physics

719.title: My message of peace from Pakistan
719.description: One of a dozen Pakistanis who came to TEDIndia despite security hassles entering the country, TED Fellow Asher Hasan shows photos of ordinary Pakistanis that drive home a profound message for citizens of all nations: look beyond disputes, and see the humanity we share.
719.author: Asher Hasan
719.keywords: TED, talks, TED Fellows, culture, entrepreneur, global issues, health, health care, peace, politics, violence, war, india

723.title: My solar-powered adventure
723.description: For the dawn of a new decade, adventurer Bertrand Piccard offers us a challenge: Find motivation in what seems impossible. He shares his own plans to do what many say can't be done -- to fly around the world, day and night, in a solar-powered aircraft.
723.author: Bertrand Piccard
723.keywords: TED, talks, adventure, aircraft, engineering, green, solar energy, technology

724.title: The neurons that shaped civilization
724.description: Neuroscientist Vilayanur Ramachandran outlines the fascinating functions of mirror neurons. Only recently discovered, these neurons allow us to learn complex social behaviors, some of which formed the foundations of human civilization as we know it.
724.author: Vilayanur Ramachandran
724.keywords: TED, talks, biology, brain, cities, cognitive science, evolution, science, neuroscience, india

726.title: Exposing the invisible
726.description: Nick Veasey shows outsized X-ray images that reveal the otherworldly inner workings of familiar objects -- from the geometry of a wildflower to the anatomy of a Boeing 747. Producing these photos is dangerous and painstaking, but the reward is a superpower: looking at what the human eye can't see.
726.author: Nick Veasey
726.keywords: TED, talks, art, nature, photography, science

727.title: How to live to be 100+
727.description: To find the path to long life and health, Dan Buettner and team study the world's "Blue Zones," communities whose elders live with vim and vigor to record-setting age. In his talk, he shares the 9 common diet and lifestyle habits that keep them spry past age 100.
727.author: Dan Buettner
727.keywords: TED, talks, TEDx, biology, culture, exploration, food, health, life, science

728.title: The real danger lurking in the water
728.description: The gharial and king cobra are two of India's most iconic reptiles, and they're endangered because of polluted waterways. Conservationist Romulus Whitaker shows rare footage of these magnificent animals and urges us to save the rivers that sustain their lives and our own.
728.author: Romulus Whitaker
728.keywords: TED, talks, animals, biodiversity, environment, water, ecology, india

734.title: How we rescued the "dancing bears"
734.description: Traditionally, the Kalandar community of India has survived by capturing sloth bear cubs and training them to "dance" through extreme cruelty. Kartick Satyanarayan has been able to put an end to this centuries-old practice, and in so doing discovered a lesson of wider significance: make the practitioners part of the solution.
734.author: Kartick Satyanarayan
734.keywords: TED, talks, activism, animals, biodiversity, environment, social change, india

735.title: Kids, take charge
735.description: Kiran Bir Sethi shows how her groundbreaking Riverside School in India teaches kids life's most valuable lesson: "I can." Watch her students take local issues into their own hands, lead other young people, even educate their parents.
735.author: Kiran Sethi
735.keywords: TED, talks, children, education, india, social change, society

736.title: Making maps to fight disaster, build economies
736.description: As of 2005, only 15 percent of the world was mapped. This slows the delivery of aid after a disaster -- and hides the economic potential of unused lands and unknown roads. In this short talk, Google's Lalitesh Katragadda demos Map Maker, a group map-making tool that people around the globe are using to map their world.
736.author: Lalitesh Katragadda
736.keywords: TED, talks, cities, collaboration, design, map, technology

738.title: All things are Moleeds
738.description: In a presentation that can only be described as epic, comedian Charles Fleischer delivers a hysterical send-up of a time-honored TED theme: the map. Geometry, numbers, charts and stamp art also factor in (somehow), as he weaves together a unique theory of everything called "Moleeds."
738.author: Charles Fleischer
738.keywords: TED, talks, astronomy, comedy, humor, map, science

743.title: 10 young Indian artists to watch
743.description: Collector Ravin Agrawal delivers a glowing introduction to 10 of India's most exciting young contemporary artists. Working in a variety of media, each draws on their local culture for inspiration.
743.author: Ravin Agrawal
743.keywords: TED, talks, Asia, art, design, future, india

744.title: Growing new organs
744.description: Anthony Atala's state-of-the-art lab grows human organs -- from muscles to blood vessels to bladders, and more. At TEDMED, he shows footage of his bio-engineers working with some of its sci-fi gizmos, including an oven-like bioreactor (preheat to 98.6 F) and a machine that "prints" human tissue.
744.author: Anthony Atala
744.keywords: TED, talks, biology, health, medicine, science, technology

748.title: Your health depends on where you live
748.description: Where you live: It impacts your health as much as diet and genes do, but it's not part of your medical records. At TEDMED, Bill Davenhall shows how overlooked government geo-data (from local heart-attack rates to toxic dumpsite info) can mesh with mobile GPS apps to keep doctors in the loop. Call it "geo-medicine."
748.author: Bill Davenhall
748.keywords: TED, talks, cities, health, health care, heart health, medicine, public health, technology

750.title: Building a theater that remakes itself
750.description: Can architects re-engineer their design process? Joshua Prince-Ramus shows how the results can be spectacular. He walks us through his fantastic re-creation of the Wyly Theater as a giant "theatrical machine" that reconfigures itself at the touch of a button.
750.author: Joshua Prince-Ramus
750.keywords: TED, talks, TEDx, architecture, creativity, design, theater

751.title: Embrace your inner girl
751.description: In this passionate talk, Eve Ensler declares that there is a girl cell in us all -- a cell that we have all been taught to suppress. She tells heartfelt stories of girls around the world who have overcome shocking adversity and violence to reveal the astonishing strength of being a girl.
751.author: Eve Ensler
751.keywords: TED, talks, culture, feminism, gender, self, social change, women

752.title: A warm embrace that saves lives
752.description: In the developing world, access to incubators is limited by cost and distance, and millions of premature babies die each year. TED Fellow Jane Chen shows an invention that could keep millions of these infants warm -- a design that's safe, portable, low-cost and life-saving.
752.author: Jane Chen
752.keywords: TED, talks, TED Fellows, children, design, entrepreneur, health, innovation, invention, medicine

755.title: Weird, or just different?
755.description: "There's a flip side to everything," the saying goes, and in 2 minutes, Derek Sivers shows this is true in a few ways you might not expect.
755.author: Derek Sivers
755.keywords: TED, talks, business, creativity, map, india

757.title: Solving social problems with a nudge
757.description: MacArthur winner Sendhil Mullainathan uses the lens of behavioral economics to study a tricky set of social problems -- those we know how to solve, but don't. We know how to reduce child deaths due to diarrhea, how to prevent diabetes-related blindness and how to implement solar-cell technology ... yet somehow, we don't or can't. Why?
757.author: Sendhil Mullainathan
757.keywords: TED, talks, big problems, brain, economics, global issues, health, sanitation, technology, women, india

759.title: The big idea my brother inspired
759.description: When Jamie Heywood's brother was diagnosed with ALS, he devoted his life to fighting the disease as well. The Heywood brothers built an ingenious website where people share and track data on their illnesses -- and they discovered that the collective data had enormous power to comfort, explain and predict.
759.author: Jamie Heywood
759.keywords: TED, talks, collaboration, community, entrepreneur, health, health care, media, medicine

761.title: A new strategy in the war on cancer
761.description: Too often, cancer treatments have a short-sighted focus on individual cells, says David Agus. He suggests a new, cross-disciplinary approach, using atypical drugs, computer modeling and protein analysis to diagnose and treat the whole body.
761.author: David Agus
761.keywords: TED, talks, cancer, health, health care, medicine, technology

762.title: The painter and the pendulum
762.description: TED visits Tom Shannon in his Manhattan studio for an intimate look at his science-inspired art. An eye-opening, personal conversation with John Hockenberry reveals how nature's forces -- and the onset of Parkinson's tremors -- interact in his life and craft.
762.author: Tom Shannon, John Hockenberry
762.keywords: TED, talks, art, astronomy, creativity, illness, science, space

763.title: How to expose the corrupt
763.description: Some of the world's most baffling social problems, says Peter Eigen, can be traced to systematic, pervasive government corruption, hand-in-glove with global companies. In his talk, Eigen describes the thrilling counter-attack led by his organization, Transparency International.
763.author: Peter Eigen
763.keywords: TED, talks, TEDx, corruption, global issues, money, politics

766.title: Augmented-reality maps
766.description: In a demo that drew gasps at TED2010, Blaise Aguera y Arcas demos new augmented-reality mapping technology from Microsoft.
766.author: Blaise Agüera y Arcas
766.keywords: TED, talks, cities, design, map, technology, virtual reality

768.title: The next age of government
768.description: The leader of Britain's Conservative Party says we're entering a new era -- where governments themselves have less power (and less money) and people empowered by technology have more. Tapping into new ideas on behavioral economics, he explores how these trends could be turned into smarter policy.
768.author: David Cameron
768.keywords: TED, talks, business, global issues, politics

769.title: The opportunity of adversity
769.description: The thesaurus might equate "disabled" with synonyms like "useless" and "mutilated," but ground-breaking runner Aimee Mullins is out to redefine the word. Defying these associations, she shows how adversity -- in her case, being born without shinbones -- actually opens the door for human potential.
769.author: Aimee Mullins
769.keywords: TED, talks, activism, happiness, health, prosthetics, social change, society

771.title: Four ways to fix a broken legal system
771.description: The land of the free has become a legal minefield, says Philip K. Howard -- especially for teachers and doctors, whose work has been paralyzed by fear of suits. What's the answer? A lawyer himself, Howard has four propositions for simplifying US law.
771.author: Philip K. Howard
771.keywords: TED, talks, business, design, health care, law

772.title: The wireless future of medicine
772.description: Eric Topol says we'll soon use our smartphones to monitor our vital signs and chronic conditions. At TEDMED, he highlights several of the most important wireless devices in medicine's future -- all helping to keep more of us out of hospital beds.
772.author: Eric Topol
772.keywords: TED, talks, disease, health, health care, medicine, technology, TEDMED

776.title: How brains learn to see
776.description: Pawan Sinha details his groundbreaking research into how the brain's visual system develops. Sinha and his team provide free vision-restoring treatment to children born blind, and then study how their brains learn to interpret visual data. The work offers insights into neuroscience, engineering and even autism.
776.author: Pawan Sinha
776.keywords: TED, talks, biology, health care, medicine, science, sight, neuroscience, india

777.title: My 5 lives as an artist
777.description: With endearing honesty and vulnerability, Raghava KK tells the colorful tale of how art has taken his life to new places, and how life experiences in turn have driven his multiple reincarnations as an artist -- from cartoonist to painter, media darling to social outcast, and son to father.
777.author: Raghava KK
777.keywords: TED, talks, art, culture, design, entertainment, india

779.title: The riddle of experience vs. memory
779.description: Using examples from vacations to colonoscopies, Nobel laureate and founder of behavioral economics Daniel Kahneman reveals how our "experiencing selves" and our "remembering selves" perceive happiness differently. This new insight has profound implications for economics, public policy -- and our own self-awareness.
779.author: Daniel Kahneman
779.keywords: TED, talks, brain, culture, economics, happiness, mind, philosophy, psychology, science

780.title: The rise of cricket, the rise of India
780.description: The tale of a major global cultural phenomenon: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle describes the spectacular arrival of fast-paced 20-20 cricket as it parallels the rise of modern India.  He traces the game from its sleepy English roots to the current world of celebrity owners and million-dollar player contracts.
780.author: Harsha Bhogle
780.keywords: TED, talks, business, culture, entertainment, india, sports

783.title: Is Pivot a turning point for web exploration?
783.description: Gary Flake demos Pivot, a new way to browse and arrange massive amounts of images and data online. Built on breakthrough Seadragon technology, it enables spectacular zooms in and out of web databases, and  the discovery of patterns and links invisible in standard web browsing.
783.author: Gary Flake
783.keywords: TED, talks, data, demo, interface design, technology, web

785.title: Before Avatar ... a curious boy
785.description: James Cameron's big-budget (and even bigger-grossing) films create unreal worlds all their own. In this personal talk, he reveals his childhood fascination with the fantastic -- from reading science fiction to deep-sea diving -- and how it ultimately drove the success of his blockbuster hits "Aliens," "The Terminator," "Titanic" and "Avatar."
785.author: James Cameron
785.keywords: TED, talks, adventure, entertainment, film, nature, oceans, storytelling, submarine, technology, writing, movies, science fiction

786.title: In the Internet age, dance evolves ...
786.description: The LXD (the Legion of Extraordinary Dancers) electrify the TED stage with an emerging global street-dance culture, revved up by the Internet. Directed by Jon M. Chu, this astonishing troupe of dancers and musicians show off their superpowers.
786.author: The LXD
786.keywords: TED, talks, collaboration, dance, entertainment, gaming, performance

787.title: Plug into your hard-wired happiness
787.description: We all strive for happiness -- but we spend most of our lives learning to be unhappy, says Srikumar Rao. In this practical talk, he teaches how to break free of the "I'd be happy if ..." mental model, and embrace our hard-wired happiness.
787.author: Srikumar Rao
787.keywords: TED, talks, business, happiness, life, mind, psychology, self

788.title: The year open data went worldwide
788.description: At TED2009, Tim Berners-Lee called for "raw data now" -- for governments, scientists and institutions to make their data openly available on the web. At TED University in 2010, he shows a few of the interesting results when the data gets linked up.
788.author: Tim Berners-Lee
788.keywords: TED, talks, Internet, computers, statistics, visualizations, web

789.title: Take Turns
789.description: Fifty percent of traffic accidents happen at intersections. Gary Lauder shares a brilliant and cheap idea for helping drivers move along smoothly: a new traffic sign that combines the properties of "Stop" and "Yield."
789.author: Gary Lauder
789.keywords: TED, talks, cities, culture, design, transportation

790.title: How I fell in love with a fish
790.description: Chef Dan Barber squares off with a dilemma facing many chefs today: how to keep fish on the menu. With impeccable research and deadpan humor, he chronicles his pursuit of a sustainable fish he could love, and the foodie's honeymoon he's enjoyed since discovering an outrageously delicious fish raised using a revolutionary farming method in Spain.
790.author: Dan Barber
790.keywords: TED, talks, agriculture, biology, environment, food, health

791.title: Medical miracle on Everest
791.description: The second deadliest day in the history of Mount Everest climbs happened in 1996 -- and Ken Kamler was the only doctor on the mountain that day. He shares the incredible story of the climbers' battle to save lives in extreme conditions, and uses brain imaging technology to map the medical miracle of one man who survived roughly 36 hours buried in the snow.
791.author: Ken Kamler
791.keywords: TED, talks, adventure, biology, exploration, humanity, medicine, science, weather

792.title: The magic of the placebo
792.description: Sugar pills, injections of nothing -- studies show that, more often than you'd expect, placebos really work. At TEDMED, magician Eric Mead does a trick to prove that, even when you know something's not real, you can still react as powerfully as if it is. (Warning: This talk is not suitable for viewers who are disturbed by needles or blood.)
792.author: Eric Mead
792.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, illusion, magic, medicine, science

796.title: Suspended animation is within our grasp
796.description: Mark Roth studies suspended animation: the art of shutting down life processes and then starting them up again. It's wild stuff, but it's not science fiction. Induced by careful use of an otherwise toxic gas, suspended animation can potentially help trauma and heart attack victims survive long enough to be treated.
796.author: Mark Roth
796.keywords: TED, talks, biology, fish, health care, science, war

797.title: Take health care off the mainframe
797.description: At TEDMED, Eric Dishman makes a bold argument: The US health care system is like computing circa 1959, tethered to big, unwieldy central systems: hospitals, doctors, nursing homes. As our aging population booms, it's imperative, he says, to create personal, networked, home-based health care for all.
797.author: Eric Dishman
797.keywords: TED, talks, business, health, health care, science, technology

800.title: We are the stories we tell ourselves
800.description: Where does creative inspiration spring from? At TEDIndia, Hollywood/Bollywood director Shekhar Kapur ("Elizabeth," "Mr. India") pinpoints his source of creativity: sheer, utter panic. He shares a powerful way to unleash your inner storyteller.
800.author: Shekhar Kapur
800.keywords: TED, talks, creativity, entertainment, film, india

801.title: Science can answer moral questions
801.description: Questions of good and evil, right and wrong are commonly thought unanswerable by science. But Sam Harris argues that science can -- and should -- be an authority on moral issues, shaping human values and setting out what constitutes a good life.
801.author: Sam Harris
801.keywords: TED, talks, culture, global issues, morality, philosophy, psychology, religion, science, evolutionary psychology

803.title: Let's simplify legal jargon!
803.description: Tax forms, credit agreements, healthcare legislation: They're crammed with gobbledygook, says Alan Siegel, and incomprehensibly long. He calls for a simple, sensible redesign -- and plain English -- to make legal paperwork intelligible to the rest of us.
803.author: Alan Siegel
803.keywords: TED, talks, business, language, law, simplicity

804.title: Why we need to go back to Mars
804.description: Planetary scientist Joel Levine shows some intriguing -- and puzzling -- new discoveries about Mars: craters full of ice, traces of ancient oceans, and compelling hints at the presence, sometime in the past, of life. He makes the case for going back to Mars to find out more.
804.author: Joel Levine
804.keywords: TED, talks, Planets, TEDx, exploration, life, science, space, technology, Mars

805.title: Music is medicine, music is sanity
805.description: Robert Gupta, violinist with the LA Philharmonic, talks about a violin lesson he once gave to a brilliant, schizophrenic musician -- and what he learned. Called back onstage later, Gupta plays his own transcription of the prelude from Bach's Cello Suite No. 1.
805.author: Robert Gupta
805.keywords: TED, talks, TED Fellows, brain, entertainment, live music, mental health, music, violin, performance

807.title: How to combat modern slavery
807.description: In this moving yet pragmatic talk, Kevin Bales explains the business of modern slavery, a multibillion-dollar economy that underpins some of the worst industries on earth. He shares stats and personal stories from his on-the-ground research -- and names the price of freeing every slave on earth right now.
807.author: Kevin Bales
807.keywords: TED, talks, Slavery, business, economics, global issues, humanity, trafficking

809.title: Teaching one child at a time
809.description: Educating the poor is more than just a numbers game, says Shukla Bose. She tells the story of her groundbreaking Parikrma Humanity Foundation, which brings hope to India's slums by looking past the daunting statistics and focusing on treating each child as an individual.
809.author: Shukla Bose
809.keywords: TED, talks, children, education, poverty, teaching, global development, india

811.title: And now, the real news
811.description: How many of today's headlines will matter in 100 years? 1000? Kirk Citron's "Long News" project collects stories that not only matter today, but will resonate for decades -- even centuries -- to come. At TED2010, he highlights recent headlines with the potential to shape our future.
811.author: Kirk Citron
811.keywords: TED, talks, future, global issues, media, news, science

818.title: Sex, drugs and HIV -- let's get rational
818.description: Armed with bracing logic, wit and her "public-health nerd" glasses, Elizabeth Pisani reveals the myriad of inconsistencies in today's political systems that prevent our dollars from effectively fighting the spread of HIV. Her research with at-risk populations -- from junkies in prison to sex workers on the street in Cambodia -- demonstrates the sometimes counter-intuitive measures that could stall the spread of this devastating disease.
818.author: Elizabeth Pisani
818.keywords: TED, talks, AIDS, global issues, health, health care, sex, HIV

819.title: The emotion behind invention
819.description: Soldiers who've lost limbs in service face a daily struggle unimaginable to most of us. At TEDMED, Dean Kamen talks about the profound people and stories that motivated his work to give parts of their lives back with his design for a remarkable prosthetic arm.
819.author: Dean Kamen
819.keywords: TED, talks, design, health, health care, medicine, prosthetics, technology, war

821.title: Every pollen grain has a story
821.description: Pollen goes unnoticed by most of us, except when hay fever strikes. But microscopes reveal it comes in stunning colors and shapes -- and travels remarkably well. Jonathan Drori gives an up-close glimpse of these fascinating flecks of plant courtship.
821.author: Jonathan Drori
821.keywords: TED, talks, bees, biology, botany, environment, life, sex

823.title: Singing old poems to life
823.description: Natalie Merchant sings from her poetry-inspired album "Leave Your Sleep," which pairs lyrics from poets -- from Gerard Manley Hopkins to a near-forgotten 10-year-old girl in Brooklyn -- with simple melodies and her unmistakable voice. Stay for an encore performance of her hit "Thank You," dedicated to a notable philanthropist in the audience.
823.author: Natalie Merchant
823.keywords: TED, talks, literature, music, performance, poetry, live music

824.title: The danger of science denial
824.description: Vaccine-autism claims, "Frankenfood" bans, the herbal cure craze: All point to the public's growing fear (and, often, outright denial) of science and reason, says Michael Specter. He warns the trend spells disaster for human progress.
824.author: Michael Specter
824.keywords: TED, talks, global issues, medicine, religion, science, writing

826.title: Photos that changed the world
826.description: Photographs do more than document history -- they make it. At TED University, Jonathan Klein of Getty Images shows some of the most iconic, and talks about what happens when a generation sees an image so powerful it can't look away -- or back.
826.author: Jonathan Klein
826.keywords: TED, talks, global issues, media, photography, poverty, war

828.title: The tradeoffs of building green
828.description: In a short, funny, data-packed talk at TED U, Catherine Mohr walks through all the geeky decisions she made when building a green new house -- looking at real energy numbers, not hype. What choices matter most? Not the ones you think.
828.author: Catherine Mohr
828.keywords: TED, talks, business, culture, green, technology, electricity

830.title: Hooked by an octopus
830.description: Underwater filmmaker Mike deGruy has spent decades looking intimately at the ocean. A consummate storyteller, he takes the stage at Mission Blue to share his awe and excitement -- and his fears -- about the blue heart of our planet.
830.author: Mike deGruy
830.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, film, fish, global issues, oceans, science, submarine, science and art, ecology, biodiversity, adventure, biology, environment, exploration, evolution, climate change, pollution, nature, activism, animals

831.title: How art gives shape to cultural change
831.description: Thelma Golden, curator at the Studio Museum in Harlem, talks through three recent shows that explore how art examines and redefines culture. The "post-black" artists she works with are using their art to provoke a new dialogue about race and culture -- and about the meaning of art itself.
831.author: Thelma Golden
831.keywords: TED, talks, art, cities, culture, design, entertainment, race

833.title: Glowing life in an underwater world
833.description: Some 80 to 90 percent of undersea creatures make light -- and we know very little about how or why. Bioluminescence expert Edith Widder explores this glowing, sparkling, luminous world, sharing glorious images and insight into the unseen depths (and brights) of the ocean.
833.author: Edith Widder
833.keywords: TED, talks, animals, design, exploration, fish, mission blue, oceans, science, technology

835.title: Homeopathy, quackery and fraud
835.description: Legendary skeptic James Randi takes a fatal dose of homeopathic sleeping pills onstage, kicking off a searing 18-minute indictment of irrational beliefs. He throws out a challenge to the world's psychics: Prove what you do is real, and I'll give you a million dollars. (No takers yet.)
835.author: James Randi
835.keywords: TED, talks, culture, health, magic, science

836.title: Bio-lab on a microchip
836.description: Drugs alone can't stop disease in sub-Saharan Africa: We need diagnostic tools to match. TED Senior Fellow Frederick Balagadde shows how we can multiply the power and availability of an unwieldy, expensive diagnostic lab -- by miniaturizing it to the size of a chip.
836.author: Frederick Balagadde
836.keywords: TED, talks, TED Fellows, biology, engineering, invention, microbiology

837.title: Build a tower, build a team
837.description: Tom Wujec presents some surprisingly deep research into the "marshmallow problem" -- a simple team-building exercise that involves dry spaghetti, one yard of tape and a marshmallow. Who can build the tallest tower with these ingredients? And why does a surprising group always beat the average?
837.author: Tom Wujec
837.keywords: TED, talks, business, collaboration, culture, design, entertainment, psychology

838.title: Political change with pen and paper
838.description: Want your local politician to pay attention to an issue you care about? Send a monthly handwritten letter, says former mayor Omar Ahmad -- it's more effective than email, phone, or even writing a check. He shares four steps to writing a letter that works.
838.author: Omar Ahmad
838.keywords: TED, talks, business, culture, democracy, politics, social change

842.title: Radical women, embracing tradition
842.description: Investing in women can unlock infinite potential around the globe. But how can women walk the line between Western-style empowerment and traditional culture? Kavita Ramdas of the Global Fund for Women talks about three encounters with powerful women who fight to make the world better -- while preserving the traditions that sustain them.
842.author: Kavita Ramdas
842.keywords: TED, talks, culture, feminism, social change, women, india

843.title: Computing a theory of all knowledge
843.description: Stephen Wolfram, creator of Mathematica, talks about his quest to make all knowledge computational -- able to be searched, processed and manipulated. His new search engine, Wolfram Alpha, has no lesser goal than to model and explain the physics underlying the universe.
843.author: Stephen Wolfram
843.keywords: TED, talks, String theory, biology, complexity, computers, math, physics, science, simplicity

844.title: Why I'm rowing across the Pacific
844.description: Five years ago, Roz Savage quit her high-powered London job to become an ocean rower. She's crossed the Atlantic solo, and just started the third leg of a Pacific solo row, the first for a woman. Why does she do it? Hear her reasons, both deeply personal and urgently activist.
844.author: Roz Savage
844.keywords: TED, talks, adventure, entertainment, global issues, goal-setting, oceans

845.title: Toward a science of simplicity
845.description: Simplicity: We know it when we see it -- but what is it, exactly? In this funny, philosophical talk, George Whitesides chisels out an answer.
845.author: George Whitesides
845.keywords: TED, talks, chemistry, complexity, design, history, simplicity, technology

846.title: Lies, damned lies and statistics (about TEDTalks)
846.description: In a brilliantly tongue-in-cheek analysis, Sebastian Wernicke turns the tools of statistical analysis on TEDTalks, to come up with a metric for creating "the optimum TEDTalk" based on user ratings. How do you rate it? "Jaw-dropping"? "Unconvincing"? Or just plain "Funny"?
846.author: Sebastian Wernicke
846.keywords: TED, talks, comedy, entertainment, statistics, humor

847.title: Social experiments to fight poverty
847.description: Alleviating poverty is more guesswork than science, and lack of data on aid's impact raises questions about how to provide it. But Clark Medal-winner Esther Duflo says it's possible to know which development efforts help and which hurt -- by testing solutions with randomized trials.
847.author: Esther Duflo
847.keywords: TED, talks, big problems, cities, economics, poverty

848.title: How great leaders inspire action
848.description: Simon Sinek has a simple but powerful model for inspirational leadership -- starting with a golden circle and the question: "Why?"  His examples include Apple, Martin Luther King Jr. and the Wright brothers ...
848.author: Simon Sinek
848.keywords: TED, talks, TEDx, business, entrepreneur, leadership, success

849.title: "Love Is a Loaded Pistol"
849.description: To write his first studio album in decades, "A Map of the Floating City," Thomas Dolby has been working in the inspirational setting of a restored lifeboat. At TED2010 he premieres a gorgeous, evocative song from that album -- about one night with a legend. He's backed by members of the modern string quartet Ethel.
849.author: Thomas Dolby
849.keywords: TED, talks, entertainment, history, live music, music

850.title: How we wrecked the ocean
850.description: In this bracing talk, coral reef ecologist Jeremy Jackson lays out the shocking state of the ocean today: overfished, overheated, polluted, with indicators that things will get much worse. Astonishing photos and stats make the case.
850.author: Jeremy Jackson
850.keywords: TED, talks, fish, green, mission blue, oceans, science, marine biology, coral reefs

851.title: India's hidden hotbeds of invention
851.description: Anil Gupta is on the hunt for the developing world's unsung inventors -- indigenous entrepreneurs whose ingenuity, hidden by poverty, could change many people's lives. He shows how the Honey Bee Network helps them build the connections they need -- and gain the recognition they deserve.
851.author: Anil Gupta
851.keywords: TED, talks, creativity, entrepreneur, innovation, invention, poverty, india

852.title: The hidden influence of social networks
852.description: We're all embedded in vast social networks of friends, family, co-workers and more. Nicholas Christakis tracks how a wide variety of traits -- from happiness to obesity -- can spread from person to person, showing how your location in the network might impact your life in ways you don't even know.
852.author: Nicholas Christakis
852.keywords: TED, talks, evolution, health, medicine, obesity, science, society, friendship

853.title: Could this laser zap malaria?
853.description: Nathan Myhrvold and team's latest inventions -- as brilliant as they are bold -- remind us that the world needs wild creativity to tackle big problems like malaria. And just as that idea sinks in, he rolls out a live demo of a new, mosquito-zapping gizmo you have to see to believe.
853.author: Nathan Myhrvold
853.keywords: TED, talks, creativity, disease, innovation, insects, invention, poverty, technology

854.title: Glimpses of a pristine ocean
854.description: Enric Sala shares glorious images -- and surprising insights and data -- from some of the most pristine areas of the ocean. He shows how we can restore more of our oceans to this healthy, balanced state, and the powerful ecological and economic benefits of doing so.
854.author: Enric Sala
854.keywords: TED, talks, economics, fish, mission blue, oceans, science, marine biology, coral reefs

855.title: Math class needs a makeover
855.description: Today's math curriculum is teaching students to expect -- and excel at -- paint-by-numbers classwork, robbing kids of a skill more important than solving problems: formulating them. Dan Meyer shows classroom-tested math exercises that prompt students to stop and think.
855.author: Dan Meyer
855.keywords: TED, talks, TEDx, children, education, math, teaching

856.title: It's time for "The Talk"
856.description: Despite her best efforts, comedian Julia Sweeney is forced to tell a little white lie when her 8-year-old begins learning about frog reproduction -- and starts to ask some very smart questions.
856.author: Julia Sweeney
856.keywords: TED, talks, children, comedy, humor, sex

860.title: Why I'm a weekday vegetarian
860.description: We all know the arguments that being vegetarian is better for the environment and for the animals -- but in a carnivorous culture, it can be hard to make the change. Graham Hill has a powerful, pragmatic suggestion: Be a weekday veg.
860.author: Graham Hill
860.keywords: TED, talks, culture, food, global issues, green

861.title: Pay attention to penguins
861.description: Think of penguins as ocean sentinels, says Dee Boersma -- they're on the frontlines of sea change. Sharing stories of penguin life and culture, she suggests that we start listening to what penguins are telling us.
861.author: Dee Boersma
861.keywords: TED, talks, animals, global issues, mission blue, oceans, science, birds

862.title: Planning for the end of oil
862.description: As the world's attention focuses on the perils of oil exploration, we present Richard Sears' talk from early February 2010. Sears, an expert in developing new energy resources, talks about our inevitable and necessary move away from oil. Toward ... what?
862.author: Richard Sears
862.keywords: TED, talks, alternative energy, energy, exploration, green, science, technology

863.title: Watch me unveil "synthetic life"
863.description: Craig Venter and team make a historic announcement: they've created the first fully functioning, reproducing cell controlled by synthetic DNA. He explains how they did it and why the achievement marks the beginning of a new era for science.
863.author: Craig Venter
863.keywords: TED, talks, DNA, biology, business, genetics, life, science, technology

866.title: Lessons from fashion's free culture
866.description: Copyright law's grip on film, music and software barely touches the fashion industry ... and fashion benefits in both innovation and sales, says Johanna Blakley. In her talk, she talks about what all creative industries can learn from fashion's free culture.
866.author: Johanna Blakley
866.keywords: TED, talks, TEDx, business, creativity, culture, design, fashion, law, media

868.title: Inside a school for suicide bombers
868.description: Filmmaker Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy takes on a terrifying question: How does the Taliban convince children to become suicide bombers? Propaganda footage from a training camp is intercut with her interviews of young camp graduates. A shocking vision.
868.author: Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy
868.keywords: TED, talks, TED Fellows, children, culture, film, politics, suicide, war

869.title: HIV and flu -- the vaccine strategy
869.description: Seth Berkley explains how smart advances in vaccine design, production and distribution are bringing us closer than ever to eliminating a host of global threats -- from AIDS to malaria to flu pandemics.
869.author: Seth Berkley
869.keywords: TED, talks, AIDS, Vaccines, global issues, health, medicine, disease, HIV

871.title: Re-examining the remix
871.description: Former "young Republican" Larry Lessig talks about what Democrats can learn about copyright from their opposite party, considered more conservative. A surprising lens on remix culture.
871.author: Lawrence Lessig
871.keywords: TED, talks, Internet, TEDx, law, music, online video, technology, web

872.title: Pointing to the future of UI
872.description: Minority Report science adviser and inventor John Underkoffler demos g-speak -- the real-life version of the film's eye-popping, tai chi-meets-cyberspace computer interface. Is this how tomorrow's computers will be controlled?
872.author: John Underkoffler
872.keywords: TED, talks, computers, design, film, interface design, invention, technology, visualizations

873.title: The ocean's glory -- and horror
873.description: Photographer Brian Skerry shoots life above and below the waves -- as he puts it, both the horror and the magic of the ocean. Sharing amazing, intimate shots of undersea creatures, he shows how powerful images can help make change.
873.author: Brian Skerry
873.keywords: TED, talks, fish, mission blue, oceans, photography, science, marine biology

874.title: The case for anonymity online
874.description: The founder of 4chan, a controversial, uncensored online imageboard, describes its subculture, some of the Internet "memes" it has launched, and the incident in which its users managed a very public, precision hack of a mainstream media website. The talk raises questions about the power -- and price -- of anonymity.
874.author: Christopher "moot" Poole
874.keywords: TED, talks, Internet, activism, collaboration, computers, culture, government, law, meme, web

876.title: Why we need the explorers
876.description: In tough economic times, our exploratory science programs -- from space probes to the LHC -- are first to suffer budget cuts. Brian Cox explains how curiosity-driven science pays for itself, powering innovation and a profound appreciation of our existence.
876.author: Brian Cox
876.keywords: TED, talks, curiosity, economics, global issues, innovation, physics, science, space

877.title: How to engineer a viral music video
877.description: The band OK Go dreamed up the idea of a massive Rube Goldberg machine for their next music video -- and Adam Sadowsky's team was charged with building it. He tells the story of the effort and engineering behind their labyrinthine creation that quickly became the YouTube sensation "This Too Shall Pass."
877.author: Adam Sadowsky
877.keywords: TED, talks, TEDx, engineering, entertainment, music, physics

878.title: The lost art of democratic debate
878.description: Democracy thrives on civil debate, Michael Sandel  says -- but we're shamefully out of practice. He leads a fun refresher, with TEDsters sparring over a recent Supreme Court case (PGA Tour Inc. v. Martin) whose outcome reveals the critical ingredient in justice.
878.author: Michael Sandel
878.keywords: TED, talks, democracy, government, law, philosophy, politics, sports

879.title: How poachers became caretakers
879.description: In his home of Namibia, John Kasaona is working on an innovative way to protect endangered animal species: giving nearby villagers (including former poachers) responsibility for caring for the animals. And it's working.
879.author: John Kasaona
879.keywords: TED, talks, Africa, animals, biodiversity, global issues, green, science

880.title: Sweat the small stuff
880.description: It may seem that big problems require big solutions, but ad man Rory Sutherland says many flashy, expensive fixes are just obscuring better, simpler answers. To illustrate, he uses behavioral economics and hilarious examples.
880.author: Rory Sutherland
880.keywords: TED, talks, creativity, design, economics, engineering, motivation, politics, simplicity

881.title: Debate: Does the world need nuclear energy?
881.description: Nuclear power: the energy crisis has even die-hard environmentalists reconsidering it. In this first-ever TED debate, Stewart Brand and Mark Z. Jacobson square off over the pros and cons. A discussion that'll make you think -- and might even change your mind.
881.author: Stewart Brand + Mark Z. Jacobson
881.keywords: TED, talks, climate change, economics, energy, environment, green, law, nuclear weapons, wind energy, Anthropocene, electricity

883.title: How architecture helped music evolve
883.description: As his career grew, David Byrne went from playing CBGB to Carnegie Hall. He asks: Does the venue make the music? From outdoor drumming to Wagnerian operas to arena rock, he explores how context has pushed musical innovation.
883.author: David Byrne
883.keywords: TED, talks, architecture, future, history, music

884.title: The pattern behind self-deception
884.description: Michael Shermer says the human tendency to believe strange things -- from alien abductions to dowsing rods -- boils down to two of the brain's most basic, hard-wired survival skills. He explains what they are, and how they get us into trouble.
884.author: Michael Shermer
884.keywords: TED, talks, God, faith, psychology, science, self, neuroscience

885.title: How YouTube thinks about copyright
885.description: Margaret Gould Stewart, YouTube's head of user experience, talks about how the ubiquitous video site works with copyright holders and creators to foster (at the best of times) a creative ecosystem where everybody wins.
885.author: Margaret Gould Stewart
885.keywords: TED, talks, art, business, creativity, culture, entertainment, law, online video, technology

886.title: The intriguing sound of marine mammals
886.description: Peter Tyack of Woods Hole talks about a hidden wonder of the sea: underwater sound. Onstage at Mission Blue, he explains the amazing ways whales use sound and song to communicate across hundreds of miles of ocean.
886.author: Peter Tyack
886.keywords: TED, talks, animals, mission blue, oceans, science, singer

888.title: Fighting cancer with dance
888.description: Renowned classical Indian dancer Ananda Shankar Jayant was diagnosed with cancer in 2008. She tells her personal story of not only facing the disease but dancing through it, and gives a performance revealing the metaphor of strength that helped her do it.
888.author: Ananda Shankar Jayant
888.keywords: TED, talks, cancer, dance, music, performance, personal growth, storytelling, india

889.title: Measuring what makes life worthwhile
889.description: When the dotcom bubble burst, hotelier Chip Conley went in search of a business model based on happiness. In an old friendship with an employee and in the wisdom of a Buddhist king, he learned that success comes from what you count.
889.author: Chip Conley
889.keywords: TED, talks, Buddhism, business, economics, happiness, money, psychology

891.title: Intricate beauty by design
891.description: In graphic design, Marian Bantjes says, throwing your individuality into a project is heresy. She explains how she built her career doing just that, bringing her signature delicate illustrations to storefronts, valentines and even genetic diagrams.
891.author: Marian Bantjes
891.keywords: TED, talks, art, design, innovation, typography

892.title: Education innovation in the slums
892.description: Charles Leadbeater went looking for radical new forms of education -- and found them in the slums of Rio and Kibera, where some of the world's poorest kids are finding transformative new ways to learn. And this informal, disruptive new kind of school, he says, is what all schools need to become.
892.author: Charles Leadbeater
892.keywords: TED, talks, cities, education, global issues, innovation

893.title: A second opinion on developmental disorders
893.description: Developmental disorders in children are typically diagnosed by observing behavior, but Aditi Shankardass suggests we should be looking directly at brains. She explains how one EEG technique has revealed mistaken diagnoses and transformed children's lives.
893.author: Aditi Shankardass
893.keywords: TED, talks, children, medicine, science, technology, neuroscience, india

894.title: LEGO for grownups
894.description: LEGO blocks: playtime mainstay for industrious kids, obsession for many (ahem!) mature adults. Hillel Cooperman takes us on a trip through the beloved bricks' colorful, sometimes oddball grownup subculture, featuring CAD, open-source robotics and a little adult behavior.
894.author: Hillel Cooperman
894.keywords: TED, talks, children, design, entertainment, entrepreneur, gaming, toy

896.title: How cognitive surplus will change the world
896.description: Clay Shirky looks at "cognitive surplus" -- the shared, online work we do with our spare brain cycles. While we're busy editing Wikipedia, posting to Ushahidi (and yes, making LOLcats), we're building a better, more cooperative world.
896.author: Clay Shirky
896.keywords: TED, talks, collaboration, community, culture, technology, wikipedia

898.title: Retrofitting suburbia
898.description: Can we rebuild our broken suburbs? Ellen Dunham-Jones shares a vision of dying malls rehabilitated, dead "big box" stores re-inhabited, and endless parking lots transformed into thriving wetlands.
898.author: Ellen Dunham-Jones
898.keywords: TED, talks, TEDx, cities, design, urban planning, infrastructure

899.title: Hidden toxins in the fish we eat
899.description: What's link between the ocean's health and our health? Marine biologist Stephen Palumbi shows how toxins at the bottom of the ocean food chain find their way into our bodies -- and tells a shocking story of toxic contamination in the fish market, where consumers were being tricked into buying fish that's not only mislabeled but unsafe.
899.author: Stephen Palumbi
899.keywords: TED, talks, fish, health, mission blue, oceans, science

900.title: A 3D atlas of the universe
900.description: For the last 12 years, Carter Emmart has been coordinating the efforts of scientists, artists and programmers to build a complete 3D visualization of our known universe. He demos this stunning tour and explains how it's being shared with facilities around the world.
900.author: Carter Emmart
900.keywords: TED, talks, art, astronomy, science, space, technology

901.title: Don't build your home, grow it!
901.description: TED Fellow and urban designer Mitchell Joachim presents his vision for sustainable, organic architecture: eco-friendly abodes grown from plants and -- wait for it -- meat.
901.author: Mitchell Joachim
901.keywords: TED, talks, TED Fellows, architecture, design, environment, urban planning

909.title: Fractals and the art of roughness
909.description: At TED2010, mathematics legend Benoit Mandelbrot develops a theme he first discussed at TED in 1984 -- the extreme complexity of roughness, and the way that fractal math can find order within patterns that seem unknowably complicated.
909.author: Benoit Mandelbrot

911.title: Life science in prison
911.description: Nalini Nadkarni challenges our perspective on trees and prisons -- she says both can be more dynamic than we think. Through a partnership with the state of Washington, she brings science classes and conservation programs to inmates, with unexpected results.
911.author: Nalini Nadkarni
911.keywords: TED, talks, crime, environment, nature, prison, social change, trees, ecology, plants, green

912.title: Global population growth, box by box
912.description: The world's population will grow to 9 billion over the next 50 years -- and only by raising the living standards of the poorest can we check population growth. This is the paradoxical answer that Hans Rosling unveils at TED@Cannes using colorful new data display technology (you'll see).
912.author: Hans Rosling
912.keywords: TED, talks, culture, data, demo, global issues, poverty, prediction, presentation

915.title: When ideas have sex
915.description: At TEDGlobal 2010, author Matt Ridley shows how, throughout history, the engine of human progress has been the meeting and mating of ideas to make new ideas. It's not important how clever individuals are, he says; what really matters is how smart the collective brain is.
915.author: Matt Ridley
915.keywords: TED, talks, business, collaboration, design, technology

916.title: Listening to global voices
916.description: Sure, the web connects the globe, but most of us end up hearing mainly from people just like ourselves. Blogger and technologist Ethan Zuckerman wants to help share the stories of the whole wide world. He talks about clever strategies to open up your Twitter world and read the news in languages you don't even know.
916.author: Ethan Zuckerman
916.keywords: TED, talks, communication, global issues, language, news, technology, web

917.title: The politics of fiction
917.description: Listening to stories widens the imagination; telling them lets us leap over cultural walls, embrace different experiences, feel what others feel. Elif Shafak builds on this simple idea to argue that fiction can overcome identity politics.
917.author: Elif Shafak
917.keywords: TED, talks, culture, novel, politics, storytelling, women

918.title: Why the world needs WikiLeaks
918.description: The controversial website WikiLeaks collects and posts highly classified documents and video. Founder Julian Assange talks to TED's Chris Anderson about how WikiLeaks operates and what drives their mission. The interview includes graphic footage of a US airstrike in Baghdad.
918.author: Julian Assange
918.keywords: TED, talks, communication, global issues, iraq, military, news, technology, surveillance

919.title: Superheroes inspired by Islam
919.description: In "THE 99," Naif Al-Mutawa's new generation of comic book heroes fight more than crime -- they smash stereotypes and battle extremism. Named after the 99 attributes of Allah, his characters reinforce positive messages of Islam and cross cultures to create a new moral framework for confronting evil, even teaming up with the Justice League of America.
919.author: Naif Al-Mutawa
919.keywords: TED, talks, Islam, art, culture, peace

920.title: How we found hundreds of potential Earth-like planets
920.description: (NOTE: This talk was given in 2010, and this field of science has developed quickly since then. Read "Criticisms & updates" below for more details.) Astronomer Dimitar Sasselov and his colleagues search for Earth-like planets that may, someday, help us answer centuries-old questions about the origin and existence of biological life elsewhere (and on Earth). Preliminary results show that they have found 706 "candidates" -- some of which further research may prove to be planets with Earth-like geochemical characteristics.
920.author: Dimitar Sasselov
920.keywords: TED, talks, Planets, astronomy, biology, extraterrestrial life, life, technology, universe, telescopes, astrobiology

921.title: A headset that reads your brainwaves
921.description: Tan Le's astonishing new computer interface reads its user's brainwaves, making it possible to control virtual objects, and even physical electronics, with mere thoughts (and a little concentration). She demos the headset, and talks about its far-reaching applications.
921.author: Tan Le
921.keywords: TED, talks, brain, computers, design, entertainment, interface design, mind, technology

922.title: The bio-future of joint replacement
922.description: Arthritis and injury grind down millions of joints, but few get the best remedy -- real biological tissue. Kevin Stone shows a treatment that could sidestep the high costs and donor shortfall of human-to-human transplants with a novel use of animal tissue.
922.author: Kevin Stone
922.keywords: TED, talks, biology, design, future, medicine, technology

924.title: The art of choosing
924.description: Sheena Iyengar studies how we make choices -- and how we feel about the choices we make. At TEDGlobal, she talks about both trivial choices (Coke v. Pepsi) and profound ones, and shares her groundbreaking research that has uncovered some surprising attitudes about our decisions.
924.author: Sheena Iyengar
924.keywords: TED, talks, business, choice, culture, decision-making, economics, psychology, social change, society

925.title: The oil spill's toxic trade-off
925.description: Break down the oil slick, keep it off the shores: that's grounds for pumping toxic dispersant into the Gulf, say clean-up overseers. Susan Shaw shows evidence it's sparing some beaches only at devastating cost to the health of the deep sea.
925.author: Susan Shaw
925.keywords: TED, talks, TEDx, business, chemistry, disaster relief, environment, fish, oceans, oil, science

926.title: Wiring an interactive ocean
926.description: Oceanographer John Delaney is leading the team that is building an underwater network of high-def cameras and sensors that will turn our ocean into a global interactive lab -- sparking an explosion of rich data about the world below.
926.author: John Delaney
926.keywords: TED, talks, mission blue, oceans, poetry, science, technology, global commons

927.title: A monkey economy as irrational as ours
927.description: Laurie Santos looks for the roots of human irrationality by watching the way our primate relatives make decisions. A clever series of experiments in "monkeynomics" shows that some of the silly choices we make, monkeys make too.
927.author: Laurie Santos
927.keywords: TED, talks, brain, business, design, economics, money, monkeys, psychology, science

928.title: My mind-shifting Everest swim
928.description: After he swam the North Pole, Lewis Pugh vowed never to take another cold-water dip. Then he heard of Lake Imja in the Himalayas, created by recent glacial melting, and Lake Pumori, a body of water at an altitude of 5300 m on Everest -- and so began a journey that would teach him a radical new way to approach swimming and think about climate change.
928.author: Lewis Pugh
928.keywords: TED, talks, activism, adventure, climate change, global issues, science, sports

929.title: How big brands can help save biodiversity
929.description: Convince just 100 key companies to go sustainable, and WWF's Jason Clay says global markets will shift to protect the planet our consumption has already outgrown. Hear how his extraordinary roundtables are getting big brand rivals to agree on green practices first -- before their products duke it out on store shelves.
929.author: Jason Clay
929.keywords: TED, talks, business, environment, green, sustainability

930.title: Our century's greatest injustice
930.description: Sheryl WuDunn's book "Half the Sky" investigates the oppression of women globally. Her stories shock. Only when women in developing countries have equal access to education and economic opportunity will we be using all our human resources.
930.author: Sheryl WuDunn
930.keywords: TED, talks, Slavery, economics, education, feminism, poverty, trafficking, women, global development

932.title: Meet Milo, the virtual boy
932.description: Peter Molyneux demos Milo, a hotly anticipated video game for Microsoft's Kinect controller. Perceptive and impressionable like a real 11-year-old, the virtual boy watches, listens and learns -- recognizing and responding to you.
932.author: Peter Molyneux
932.keywords: TED, talks, AI, children, computers, design, gaming, psychology, technology

934.title: The Axis of Evil Middle East Comedy Tour
934.description: Jamil Abu-Wardeh jump-started the comedy scene in the Arab world by founding the Axis of Evil Middle East Comedy Tour, which brings standup comedians to laughing audiences all over the region. He's found that, by respecting the "three B's" (blue material, beliefs and "bolitics"), the Axis of Evil comics find plenty of cross-border laughs.
934.author: Jamil Abu-Wardeh

937.title: The beauty of data visualization
937.description: David McCandless turns complex data sets (like worldwide military spending, media buzz, Facebook status updates) into beautiful, simple diagrams that tease out unseen patterns and connections. Good design, he suggests, is the best way to navigate information glut -- and it may just change the way we see the world.
937.author: David McCandless
937.keywords: TED, talks, complexity, computers, data, design, visualizations

938.title: Inside an Antarctic time machine
938.description: Science columnist Lee Hotz describes a remarkable project at WAIS Divide, Antarctica, where a hardy team are drilling into ten-thousand-year-old ice to extract vital data on our changing climate.
938.author: Lee Hotz
938.keywords: TED, talks, climate change, news, science, Antarctica

939.title: Learning from Sherman the shark
